Title: Shipping Policy
Body HTML:
Thank you for choosing PEARL iZUMi for your cycling needs. Please review our shipping policy to understand our shipping methods, costs and estimated delivery times.

Order Processing

Shipping Method Delivery¬†Time Cost
FedEx Ground Economy 3-8 Business Days $8.99
FedEx Ground Economy¬≤ 3-8 Business Days FREE on orders of $99+
FedEx 2-Day Air 2 Business Days $25
FedEx Standard Overnight 1 Business Day $35

¬≤Free FedEx Ground Economy is available for orders of $99 or more. Order total is calculated before tax and after any applicable discounts and/or promotions are applied. Gift Card values do not apply towards the $99 order total. The free FedEx Ground Economy order threshold for our Pro Customers is $175 or more.

¬†

FedEx Ground Economy:

FedEx Ground Economy shipping cost $8.99 for orders below $99. Free FedEx Ground Economy shipping is available for orders of $99 or more. Order total is calculated before tax and after any applicable discounts and/or promotions are applied. Gift Card values do not apply towards the $99 order total to qualify for free shipping. Orders are packed and shipped within 1-2 business days. Estimated transit time is 2-6 business days, but may vary depending on factors such as shipping destination, weather conditions and the carrier's operational schedule. Available to ship to PO Boxes or APO/DPO addresses. Shipping to Hawaii and Alaska may take longer to arrive.

FedEx 2-Day Air:

Available to ship to all physical US addresses. Not available to ship to PO Boxes or APO/DPO addresses. Orders must be received by 11:00 AM PT (Monday through Friday) to ensure the order is processed the same day. Any 2nd Day orders received after 11:00 AM PT, on weekends or holidays will be processed the next business day. Delivery to Hawaii and Alaska may take 3 business days.

FedEx Standard Overnight:

Available to ship to all physical US addresses. Not available to ship to PO Boxes or APO/DPO addresses. Orders must be received by 11:00 AM PT (Monday through Friday) to ensure the order is processed the same day. Any Next Day orders received after 11:00 AM PT, on weekends or holidays will be processed the next business day. Delivery to Hawaii and Alaska may take 2-3 business days.

Additional Shipping Notes:

All orders are shipped via FedEx from our distribution center in Southern California. Once your order has been shipped, you will receive a confirmation email containing a tracking number. You can use this number to track the progress of your shipment on the carrier's website.

Please ensure that you place your order with a correct and complete shipping address to prevent any delivery issues. Once an order has been placed, we are unable to modify the address. PEARL iZUMi will not be responsible for orders sent to an incorrect address provided by the customer or for orders that are returned due incorrect addresses or undeliverable addresses.

Pro Customers

FedEx Ground Economy (Pro):

FedEx Ground Economy (Pro) shipping cost $8.99 for orders below $175. Orders are packed and shipped within 1-2 business days. Estimated transit time is 2-7 business days, but may vary depending on factors such as shipping destination, weather conditions and¬†the carrier's operational schedule. Available to ship to PO Boxes or APO/DPO addresses. Shipping to Hawaii and Alaska may take longer to arrive.

FREE FedEx Ground Economy (Pro):

Free FedEx Ground Economy (Pro) shipping is available for orders of $175 or more. Order total is calculated before tax and after any applicable pro discounts and/or promotions are applied. Orders are packed and shipped within 1-2 business days. Estimated transit time is 2-7 business days, but may vary depending on factors such as shipping destination, weather conditions and¬†the carrier's operational schedule. Available to ship to PO Boxes or APO/DPO addresses. Shipping to Hawaii and Alaska may take longer to arrive.

Questions?

If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to contact our customer service team at info@pearlizumi.com or 800-328-8488.

Last updated: 05.01.25

Become a 2026 PEARL iZUMi
Ambassador!

JOIN THE RIDE

PEARL iZUMi
Ambassador
Application

We believe the best rides start with community‚Äîand that means you. 2026 is your year to step out of the grind, silence the ‚Äútomorrow‚Äù excuse, and ride into something bigger.
¬†
Applications are officially open! Join the PEARL iZUMi family, connect with fellow riders, and be part of a movement that‚Äôs rewriting what it means to ride.
¬†
Apply now to become a 2026 PEARL iZUMi Ambassador.

Please complete the application below to be considered for the PEARL iZUMi 2023 Ambassador Program. Applications are due by February 28th, midnight MST. Applicants will be notified of their acceptance on March 3rd.

Title: Autumn Adventures on Gravel: Top Gear Picks for Cooler Rides
Body HTML:
üèÜ

Top List

Autumn Adventures on Gravel: Top Gear Picks for Cooler Rides

As the leaves turn and the crisp air of autumn begins to set in, gravel riders gear up for some of the most scenic and satisfying rides of the year. In this guide, we delve into the essential gear from PEARL iZUMi that will keep you comfortable on your 'Autumn Adventures on Gravel.' We‚Äôve selected items like our Men's Expedition Thermal Cycling Bib Tights and Women's Quest Barrier Jacket for their perfect blend of warmth and adaptability during the cooler, ever-changing ride conditions that are hallmarks of the fall season.

Knowledge from

4 Experts

Your Perfect Companion for Fall Gravel Rides

Conquering the Chill with the Quest AmFIB¬Æ Jacket

Embracing the cooler temperatures and gusty winds of autumn doesn't mean sacrificing comfort on your gravel rides. The PEARL iZUMi Men's Quest AmFIB¬Æ Jacket stands as a testament to the fusion of warmth and functionality. Touting our PRO 3-layer, fleece-backed AmFIB softshell fabric, this jacket emerges as the armor you need against the insidious bite of cold winds and the capriciousness of fall weather with its impressive windproof and water-resistant qualities.

With versatility at its core, the jacket‚Äôs relaxed fit accommodates a diverse range of layering, giving you the freedom to adjust to the day's demands. Imagine heading out on a brisk morning; your torso cocooned in the warm embrace of the Quest AmFIB¬Æ Jacket, unfazed by the inverted thermometer readings. When the sun capitulates to grey clouds and errant raindrops patter on the softshell exterior, you remain unperturbed, knowing that your jacket's water resistance maintains your comfort. Safety need not be a concern as the fading light of dusk approaches; the jacket includes reflective elements to ensure visibility during your post-sunset pedal.

Moreover, the jacket's thoughtful design eliminates the chill's desperate reach with dual waist adjusters and features a rear zippered pocket to secure your smartphone or energy snacks. This is more than a jacket; it's a statement that your riding season is far from over‚Äîit's simply entering a new, thrilling chapter.

‚úì

Windproof softshell

‚úì

Water-resistant

‚úì

Fleece-backed fabric

‚úì

Reflective elements

"Packable and lightweight, ideal for a quick layer"

written by

Quin F.

$65.00

Men's Quest AmFIB¬Æ Jacket

Staying Agile and Protected on Your Gravel Journey

Embracing the Elements: The Women's Quest Barrier Jacket

As the crisp air of autumn whispers through the turning leaves, gravel riders are reaching for that perfect piece of gear to shield them from the unpredictable elements of the season. The Women's Quest Barrier Jacket by PEARL iZUMi stands out as an essential ally against chilly winds and unexpected drizzles. Its lightweight construction does not weigh down the adventurous spirit but offers an invisible armor against the biting wind. Equipped with a durable water-repellent finish, the Quest Barrier Jacket sheds light rain effortlessly, ensuring that a sudden sprinkle won't dampen your ride.

With a thoughtful combination of functionality and comfort, the Quest Barrier Jacket features a relaxed fit and an array of sizes up to 3XL, catering to a wide range of cyclists. This comfortable fit ensures the jacket can be layered over other cycling attire with ease, adapting to your personal warmth preferences without restricting movement. Safety is also paramount as dusk falls earlier; the reflective elements integrated into the jacket enhance visibility, making it a beacon of security as visibility wanes.

Transitioning smoothly from trail to town, PEARL iZUMi's emphasis on versatile styling is evident in this piece. The BioViz¬Æ reflective elements aren't just practical; they also add a subtle stylistic flair, complementing the jacket's overall aesthetic. Whether paired with the Women's Attack Air Jersey for additional warmth or worn over a lightweight base layer on milder days, the Quest Barrier Jacket is your adaptable companion for autumnal escapades.

‚úì

Water-repellent finish

‚úì

Extended sizing to 3XL

‚úì

Reflective safety elements

‚úì

Lightweight layering

Perfect for Fall rides that turn chilly quick!

written by

Jane T.

$34.00

Women's Quest Barrier Jacket

Stay Warm and Agile on Your Gravel Grinds

Conquer Chilly Trails with Confidence

As the leaves paint the landscapes with hues of amber and gold, your gravel riding adventures shouldn‚Äôt come to a halt. This is where the Men's Expedition Thermal Cycling Bib Tights stride in, blending warmth and convenience exceptionally well. Designed with ELITE ThermaFleece fabric, these bib tights provide not only quick-drying insulation but also ample stretch for unrestricted pedaling. Imagine riding through crisp fall mornings; the dual-density ELITE Levitate chamois cushions you for the long haul, striking that perfect balance between comfort and support.

Seizing the day when the weather refuses to cooperate is made easier by the PI Dry¬Æ technology, allowing you to shrug off water and dirt flung up by your gravel tires. Moreover, the thoughtfully crafted laser-cut bib straps contribute to a seamless fit, eliminating the necessity for extra binding and ensuring that little to no chafing will interrupt your journey. And when nature calls amidst your ride, the unique strap design provides a convenient drop-tail nature break accessibility that‚Äôs zipper and clasp-free.

To top it off, invaluable side cargo pockets are ready to stash your essentials, ensuring you're well-prepared to face the unpredictability of autumn terrains. So don't let cooler temperatures deter your enthusiasm for gravel riding ‚Äî grab your Men's Expedition Thermal Cycling Bib Tights and witness firsthand how they transform both your comfort and performance during those hearty fall rides.

‚úì

ELITE ThermaFleece fabric

‚úì

Dual-density ELITE Levitate chamois

‚úì

PI Dry¬Æ water-shedding technology

‚úì

Nature break friendly design

Long legs for cold, pockets for snacks, ideal.

written by

Nicolas M.

$92.50

Men's Expedition Thermal Cycling Bib Tights

Your Trusty Companion for Autumn Gravel Rides

Embrace the Elements: Women's Expedition Bib Shorts

As autumn whispers through the rustling leaves and the call of adventure leads you to cooler and unpredictable terrain, PEARL iZUMi's Women's Expedition Bib Shorts stand ready as your steadfast companion on the journey. Meticulously crafted with the highest standards, these bib shorts are a testament to both comfort and technical prowess, making them a must-have for the gravel enthusiast. The high-stretch Transfer fabric provides a compressive yet sleek fit, ensuring you feel supported without restriction, a quintessential trait for the dynamic demands of gravel riding.

Integrated within is our proprietary ELITE Levitate dual-density chamois‚Äîwith an innovative suspension core‚Äîintroduces an unprecedented level of cushioning and road noise dampening. Long rides over scattered pebbles and uneven paths become a joy rather than a jarring experience. The thoughtful design extends to the drop-tail construction, granting you a respite in nature without the cumbersome need to remove layers. This, paired with laser-cut straps, abolishes the worry of chafing and discomfort.

Moreover, the strategically placed pockets beckon the minimalist rider, who prefers the freedom from a traditional jersey, allowing for the safe stowage of essentials right at the fingertips. Offering unparalleled performance, the Women's Expedition Bib Shorts merge practicality with PEARL iZUMi's renowned quality to fit the adventurous spirit of the gravel rider.

‚úì

Moisture-wicking Transfer fabric

‚úì

ELITE Levitate chamois

‚úì

Convenient drop-tail design

‚úì

Silicone gripper leg openings

Comfy for long rides and enough pockets to stay fueled the whole way through!

written by

Matilda C.

$97.50

Women's Expedition Bib Shorts

Title: Comfort Meets Endurance: PEARL iZUMi's Best Men's Chamois Lineup
Body HTML:
üèÜ

Top List

Comfort Meets Endurance: PEARL iZUMi's Best Men's Chamois Lineup

Embarking on a cycling adventure means confronting the road with resilience and steadfast comfort. PEARL iZUMi's Best Men's Chamois Lineup is crafted for those who push the limits and cherish longevity in the saddle. Our highlighted products, including the Men's PRO Shorts and Men's PRO Bib Shorts, are designed with the premium Levitate PRO chamois for superior support and comfort, enabling riders to strive for endurance with unwavering confidence.

Knowledge from

4 Experts

Tailored Endurance for Passionate Cyclists

Elevating Performance: The Men's PRO Bib Shorts

Long days and enduring rides demand gear that is both reliable and supremely comfortable. The Men's PRO Bib Shorts by PEARL iZUMi stand up to the challenge, effortlessly combining high-performance materials with engineering finesse. Built for the dedicated cyclist, these bib shorts offer the support and stretch needed to conquer any road or trail. The Italian PRO Transfer fabric not only ensures a luxurious feel but also maximizes breathability and moisture-wicking properties, keeping the rider cool and dry.

Delving deeper, the innovative PRO Levitate chamois at the heart of these shorts is rigorously designed to minimize friction, encourage airflow, and provide cushioned comfort without unnecessary bulk. Perfect for those century rides or competitive races, the PRO Bib Shorts integrate BioViz reflective elements for safety during dawn or dusk journeys. With an array of sizes and colors, riders can find their perfect fit, embracing both style and substance. Embrace the superior fit, cutting-edge chamois technology, and unyielding quality that define these PEARL iZUMi bib shorts ‚Äì your trusted companion on the road to endurance.

Tailored Endurance for Unrivaled Comfort

Elevate Your Ride with the Men's Attack Air Bib Shorts

Finding the perfect balance between endurance and comfort in cycling gear can be as challenging as the ride itself. This is where the Men's Attack Air Bib Shorts shine - meticulously engineered for those high-output efforts that demand more from you and your attire. The radius of these bib shorts is defined by the dual-density ELITE Levitate chamois, which offers just the right level of support, even several hours into your journey. And, when it comes to maintaining that streamlined, aero position, the raw-edge bib uppers and laser cut leg openings are your unspoken heroes, keeping everything in place without compromising movement. The lightweight, 4-way stretch fabric contributes essential breathability, a welcome feature for when the path takes a turn towards the sun-baked pavement. Additionally, strategically placed perforated venting on the lower back region acts as a pivotal cooling agent, which is particularly critical during those long summer climbs.

PEARL iZUMi's commitment to both aesthetics and functionality is evident in the range of choices, from sleek blacks to high-visibility variants, ensuring you're not only outfitted for endurance but also for style and safety. Moreover, silicone-printed grippers negate the sliding and bunching that could otherwise bring discomfort to protracted rides. With every detail, from the thoughtful chamois to the meticulously placed venting, the Men's Attack Air Bib Shorts are not just an item of clothing; they're a companion for your cycling expeditions, ready to endure as much as you are.

Where High-End Crafting Meets Cutting-Edge Technology

Achieving Peak Performance with Men's PRO Shorts

The quintessence of PEARL iZUMi's commitment to finesse and function shines through in the Men's PRO Shorts, conceived for the dedicated cyclist who demands both comfort and performance. These premium shorts, with their signature PRO Levitate chamois, are designed to provide unparalleled support and comfort on even the most grueling of rides. The PRO Levitate chamois, lauded for its triple-density construction, offers a stretchable contour that moves fluidly with the body, minimizing friction and accommodating your position as you power through the miles.

Crafted with a meticulous seven-panel design, the Men's PRO Shorts reduce seams, thereby enhancing the sleek fit while ensuring a smooth feel against the skin. This thoughtful construction is complemented by Italian PRO Transfer fabric that offers a touch of luxury with its high-end performance capabilities. The integration of raw edge hems augments aerodynamics and eradicates any discomfort, allowing riders to be entirely in sync with their tempo. The stabilizing, printed silicone grippers and strategically designed wide waistband fortify these shorts, ensuring they stay put sans constriction, enabling cyclists to remain laser-focused on the path ahead.

Furthermore, visibility is not sidelined. With the addition of BioViz¬Æ reflective elements, riders can be confident in their safety during low-light conditions, assuring peace of mind when the daylight fades. Offered in an array of variants, from bold TWILIGHT to understated BLACK, the Men's PRO Shorts cater to personal style preferences while never compromising on quality. Indeed, these shorts rise to the challenge, ready to be a core part of your cyclewear ensemble, irrespective of the journey's demand.

Redefining Endurance for Cyclists Everywhere

The Engineered Comfort of Men's Attack Shorts

PEARL iZUMi‚Äôs Men‚Äôs Attack Shorts stand out as a hallmark of the union between comfort and endurance. With each pedal stroke, cyclists will appreciate the thoughtful design that caters to both the thrill of speed and the demands of long-distance riding. The ELITE Levitate chamois pad, embedded in these shorts, is much more than just cushioning. Its dual-density foam construction ensures that comfort isn‚Äôt just momentary but sustained throughout your journey, whether it is a quick dash or a marathon ride. Moreover, these shorts are perfect for the varied climates and exertion levels cyclist encounter.

For the devoted cyclist, the Attack Shorts serve as a trusty companion. Crafted using soft polyester knit fabric, they guarantee not just superb mobility but also the right degree of compression, integral for both muscle support and recovery. The inclusion of low profile elastic leg bands further fortifies this balance, keeping everything in place without ever hindering your movements. Even as you challenge your limits, these shorts stay unwaveringly dedicated to your cause. Adding functionality to form, the Attack Shorts come in a range of sizes and eye-catching color variants, ensuring a match for every rider and every style.

Yet features like breathable fabric and a supportive chamois are not just for show ‚Äî they're the result of PEARL iZUMi‚Äôs dedication to creating gear that empowers cyclists to push further, ride longer, and embrace the ride discomfort-free. Whether you‚Äôre an endurance aficionado or a newcomer building up stamina, the Men‚Äôs Attack Shorts are geared to become a staple in your riding wardrobe, transforming your cycling experience to one of unparalleled comfort and endurance.

Title: Winter Tights Guide
Body HTML:
GUIDE TO

WINTER TIGHTS

COOL & COLD WEATHER

GUIDE TO

WINTER TIGHTS

COOL & COLD WEATHER

As the season transitions and the chill in the air becomes more pronounced, don't let the colder weather put a freeze on your cycling adventures. PEARL iZUMi's winter tights are engineered to turn the cold into a companion on your journey, not a barrier. With innovative fabrics and cyclist-centered designs, we ensure that every pedal you push is in comfort and warmth, empowering you to embrace the beauty of winter riding. Because at PEARL iZUMi, we believe that the right gear can make any weather, perfect weather.

As the season transitions and the chill in the air becomes more pronounced, don't let the colder weather put a freeze on your cycling adventures. PEARL iZUMi's winter tights are engineered to turn the cold into a companion on your journey, not a barrier. Because at PEARL iZUMi, we believe that the right gear can make any weather, perfect weather.

CONQUER THE COLD: UNVEILING THE POWER OF WINTER TIGHTS

CONQUER THE COLD: UNVEILING THE POWER OF WINTER TIGHTS

When the temperature drops, your determination doesn't have to. PEARL iZUMi's winter cycling tights are your shield against the cold, crafted to keep you warm, comfortable, and focused on the ride ahead. But not all tights are created equal, and choosing the right one can make all the difference in your winter cycling experience. No matter your choice, winter tights are your allies against the cold, designed with the understanding that every ride is an opportunity to explore further, push harder, and discover more ‚Äî weather be damned.

Title: Athletes & Ambassadors
Body HTML:
Meet Our Athletes

Our athletes come from wildly diverse backgrounds and have equally diverse plans and goals for the upcoming season. The common thread that ties them all together is the way in which they engage with their respective communities and give back to the cycling community at large.

Alexey
Vermeulen

GENERAL BIO

My name is Alexey Vermeulen. I grew up in Michigan and started my career on the road before transitioning to the dirt to race gravel and mountain bikes in 2019. I am most well known for riding with my dachshund, named Willie, on my back while training. My biggest wins to date include 3x Iceman Cometh, BWR SD, 2x Chequamegon 40 and 2x podium in the Lifetime Grand Prix Overall!

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
Riding from Boulder to Crested Butte over 3 days during Covid. Coming from road racing, I had rarely done multi day point to point rides, but the lack of racing during the pandemic opened up the opportunity! 300 miles and 30,000 feet with a good friend over old mining passes, and it was a ride I will never forget!
¬†
What got you into cycling?
I got into cycling through my grandfather (OPA) who had raced in Holland before WWII. After immigrating to Canada after the war, his love of bikes rubbed off on me and we shared rides whenever he came to visit. My first foray into racing was at a kids triathlon with my mom and from then on my passion grew each year!
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
In 2017 I was out riding in Girona with friends and we found what could only have been a pet bunny hopping up the road. We picked it up and carried it about 3km into the next town where we randomly ran into a family/girl wandering around the coffee shop we stopped at...we didn't need a translator to figure out it was her bunny. Quite an end to the day as we were contemplating how to ride down the mountain with a bunny in our jersey!
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
Do dogs count? Sir Willie the wiener and my girlfriend Sophie Linn.
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Chocolate milk and cold pizza.

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

Men's Expedition Thermal Bib Tights, Men's PRO NeoShell WXB Jacket, Thermal Gloves

Allin
Pauline

GENERAL BIO

I'm 28 years old. I'm about to start my 2nd season with Cynisca. I'm French and I live in Charente Maritime. I've been cycling competitively for 12 years. I've taken part in the best races (Tour de France, Giro, Paris Roubaix, Li√®ge Bastogne Li√®ge...). I won a stage in the Tour de l'Ard√®che and the Francophonie games.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
Tour de France for the atmosphere.
¬†
What got you into cycling?
My family.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
Going to Africa and see what life is like there (Francophonie games).
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
My family (father and brother).
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Pancakes.

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

PRO NeoShell WXB Jacket

Allison (Alli)
Mrugal

GENERAL BIO

I am 27 from West Chester, Pennsylvania, USA and currently living in Girona, Spain. I made the switch from mountain bike racing to road racing in 2021 because I loved the long hours in the saddle and tactical nature of the road (and it was secretly a dream of mine to race in the Women‚Äôs World Tour one day). I raced domestically before following my heart to the international scene. In 2023, I acquired valuable experience with the Spanish continental team Sopela Women‚Äôs Team and raced in (you betcha) the Women‚Äôs World Tour! I feel so blessed to continue to follow my heart and live from my dreams everyday.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
I have so many favorite rides. But one that really showed me what I was made of was last year on stage 2 of La Vuelta. I crashed on a man-hole cover not 10 meters into start of the race and switched to a teammates bike. All of a sudden, I felt like an absolute beginner again. I got caught up in more crashes, fought back. I used all of my matches and couldn't hang anymore. I will never forget seeing the helicopter fly out of sight and the wind whipping across the brush on the side of the road. We weren‚Äôt even half-way through the stage and it felt impossible to finish within the time limit. But I knew it was the opportunity of a lifetime to even be there‚Äîit was my first grand tour, heck, my first world tour race. I was really proud to finish that day and to go on to finish the tour.
¬†
What got you into cycling?
My parents have been avid cyclists all of my life. They never put any pressure on my sister and I to ride. We actually actively rejected it growing up and did almost every other sport except cycling. But cycling is more than just the riding a bike. It's a sense of community, adventure, mastery...they exposed us to all of that without knowing. When I was coming back from injury from other sports in my senior year of high school, I gave it a shot and I just never stopped.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
It‚Äôs not the most glamorous thing but it‚Äôs crazy drivers.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
My imagination!
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
A smoothie with banana!

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

I mean this when I say it: get yourself a pair of PEARL iZUMi shoes covers, leg warmers, and socks. I have the AmFib Shoe Covers, Elite Thermal Leg Warmers, Merino Air 7‚Äù Socks. I started cycling with PEARL iZUMi hand-me-downs and have also upgraded my wardrobe with PEARL iZUMi. Let me tell you these items last for YEARS. They are stylish, comfortable, and can do the work!

Andrew
L'Esperance

GENERAL BIO

My name is Andrew L'Esperance and I grew up on the east coast of Canada, in Halifax, Nova Scotia. I am currently living in the Eastern Townships just east of Montreal, Quebec. I race MTB and gravel bikes for Maxxis Factory Racing and love all different kinds of riding. I come from a World Cup XCO background and have been transitioning more into the endurance MTB and gravel space the past two years. Throughout my XCO career I always was drawn to the adventure races and managed to fit them in at the beginning or end of the season. I have had very cool experiences racing MTB stage races like Croc Trophy in North Queensland in Australia, Epic Israel, Swiss Epic and a few others. Now, races like these and many other are standard on the schedule, and that's pretty cool. I am the current Canadian MTB Marathon National Champion and am 2x BC Bike Race Champion, winning in 2021 and 2023. I finished 6th overall in the LTGP in 2022.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
Woah, tough question, so many amazing rides! My favourite ride ever has to be a single-day ride around the Cabot Trail on Cape Breton Island in Northern Nova Scotia. It is a stunning 300 km loop with several big climbs. I did it with two very good friends, Geoff and Dustin, and we camped the night before, got up at sunrise and just rode the whole day. It was my first super long day on the bike and it was incredible. It took 10 hours and we ripped it! I have not gotten back to do it since, that was about 10 years ago, so I have to make that happen!
¬†
What got you into cycling?
I was lucky to have access to bikes and fun terrain to ride them growing up. Our family rode bikes together on vacation and I rode with my older brothers. I am the youngest of 4 boys. My oldest brother, whom I massively looked up to, did a few bike races and of course, I had to do a bike race. From there, well, I did my first race, a local Tuesday-nighter short track and I just kept going.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
We were on the island of Maui for a training camp during the time 4-5 years ago when there was a false alarm nuclear missile warning. We were just starting our ride when the notification came to our phones. We stopped as a group and tried to figure out what to do. At this time, with the information we had, there was an incoming missile. We discussed and someone took the lead and we reasoned that things didn't look good no matter where we were, so we decided to keep riding. It was a surreal experience. About 1-2 hours into the ride we got a notification that it was a false alarm. We had a good ride but really only fully understood what had happened once we got and saw the news. Wild experience, still gives me chills thinking about it.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
My wife Haley. We are both professional bike pedallers and we feel fortunate we get to be on this journey together.
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
A good Burrito and a Jaritos.

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

Canyon EcoLoft Jacket, PRO Alpha Layer (I haven't tried it yet but I know I will like it), PRO Bib Shorts

Ashley
Frye

GENERAL BIO

I‚Äôm Ashley Frye and I‚Äôm from Austin, Texas - yeehaw! This will be my second year road racing and second year on Cynisca Cycling. I really like long climbs and would consider myself a ‚Äúclimber,‚Äù but am trying to work on all areas of riding expertise. Last year was my first year of racing and I am proud to say that a had 17 top twenty and six top ten finishes! This past year was a great first year, and I am excited for another year of racing and look to have some podium finishes ü§©

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
My favorite ride that I‚Äôve ever done is probably the Copper Triangle gran fondo in Colorado. This ride is special to me, because I‚Äôve done it several times with my dad!
¬†
What got you into cycling?
Watching my dad do triathlons growing up.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
One time I ran over a raccoon.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
My dad, Brandon Frye!
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Pancakes with almond butter.

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

Shoe Covers to keep my toesies warm, Thermal Bib Tights¬†

Brendan
Johnston

GENERAL BIO

I am 32 year old father of 1 year old Maeve, husband to Sue. I live in Canberra, Australia. I have been racing bikes for close to 20 years. I started out with XC mountain bike racing have done road, marathon mountain bike and gravel since. I have 6 national titles, and have stood on the podium at the National Road championships. I have worked as an electrician for the my whole career until the past 2 years where i have moved to a more full time focus on racing and the Life Time Grand Prix.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
I love riding from my home in Canberra to the South East Coast of Australia (where i grew up). It's about 180km and I usually ride home for Christmas to see my family.
¬†

¬†
What got you into cycling?
My dad got me into cycling through a local junior program (shout out to Rock Creek Velo!)
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
Racing Tour de l‚ÄôAvenir and seeing the names of men‚Äôs Tour de France racers paints on the climbs
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
My younger sister.
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Yogurt and granola.

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

Thermal Gloves and Tank Baselayer

Lauren
Stephens

GENERAL BIO

I‚Äôm from Texas. Always lived in the Dallas area. I love any kind of riding. I‚Äôve been racing for over ten years and am lucky to have a list of successes. The neatest result I have is I‚Äôve been a national champion in 3 different disciplines, track, road and gravel.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
MTB ride from Angel Fire to Taos and back. It felt like an impossible adventure at times. I had planned to only go one direction. But once I was in Taos I thought I can do this. So Mat and I took off. At times I regretted my decision. But I. The end I was proud of my self and went on to have a pretty great rest of the season. Because everytime I was suffering I thought back to how this particular ride was harder.
¬†
What got you into cycling?
I love endurance sports and exploring.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
Just getting to ride and explore in so many different countries.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
My husband Mat.
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Sourdough bread with a little oil and cheese.

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

Baselayers for sure!!

Mara
Roldan

GENERAL BIO

My name is Mara Roldan, and I am 18 years old. I am a first year u23 rider. I was born in Whitehorse, Yukon and have lived a nomadic lifestyle with my family for most of my life. We lived in Costa Rica for six months, moved to Qu√©bec and lived on a farm for a few years, then eventually we sold everything and moved in a bus, in which my family has now lived in for almost 10 years. I picked up biking in the states and predominantly raced only mountain bikes until 2 years ago when I discovered road. I raced both a full road and mountain bike season in 2022 where I managed to grab the junior national criterium champion title, as well as represent Canada at various UCI and non UCI mountain bike and road events, including XCO mountain bike world championships. After completing my online high school on the road, I moved to Victoria where I have now just finished my second year in Kinesiology at Camosun College. I am no predominantly focusing on the road with my Cynisca Cycling and am really looking forward to gain more experience racing in Europe, learning from my teammates, and hopefully representing them on a few podium steps!

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
Either the Big Loop on Vancouver island, which is a 250km ride that I did with two of my friends last summer. Another favorite would be the Kluane to Chilkat bike relay which starts in the Yukon and finishes in Alaska.
¬†
What got you into cycling?
My parents were the ones who introduced me to mountain biking at a relatively young age while travelling around North America. However, I did not compete until the age of 13, when I met a family who did mountain bike races down in Arizona. We happened to go to an event with them and I signed up, and immediately fell in love with competing on two wheels!
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
Probably seeing a grizzly bear with her cubs while riding in the Yukon!
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
Too hard to just pick one. Probably my dad, my sisters, teammates and friends at home.
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Fresh sourdough bread with butter!

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

My favourites would have to be the PRO Bib Shorts, the Attack Rain Jacket, and the Lite Shoe Covers.

Mark
Matthews

GENERAL BIO

For over a decade, I've blended my riding talent with a creative approach. Coming from Vancouver Island, Canada, I'm passionate about contributing to new trails in my community. Having participated in major events such as Red Bull Rampage and Crankworx Whistler, my distinctive style and seamless flow on the bike attract a broad audience.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
In Cappadocia, Turkey. It's a magical location and a crazy feeling to rip through those sandstone formations at sunrise with hot air ballons surrounding you.
¬†
What got you into cycling?
Inspired by older kids on BMX bikes at school, I delved into tricks, and my interest naturally evolved into mountain biking. The passion grew as I met more riders, rode more places, and got hooked on the MTB community.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
Seeing Jordie Lunn's Tree Roll in person.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
Whoever is available mid-week!
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Tacos!

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

Men's Canyon ECOLoft‚Ñ¢ Jacket, Elevate Jerseys, Elevate Pants

Nicole
Steinmetz

GENERAL BIO

I'm from Loomis, CA and am currently in my 3rd year at Arizona State University. I have been riding since I was a toddler, but switched from ultra distance cycling to racing only 2 years ago. I am a climber and love to spend training days in the mountains. I do mostly road racing, but I have done a few Lifetime Gravel races in the past. Last year was my first time racing in Europe, and I loved it, so I'm super excited to do more racing there this season.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
For my 18th birthday, I decided to celebrate my freedom by doing a 400 mile route through the Tahoe National Forest in California. The scenery was amazing, and it was essentially a 30 hour long birthday celebration (with accompanying amounts of birthday cake). Definitely a day to remember!
¬†
What got you into cycling?
My mom was very much into ultra distance cycling when I was younger, so I naturally wanted to join in on the fun! We rode together up until college, where I was introduced to racing and realized my passion for it.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
I was told to "watch out for the wild boars" at a house I was staying at in France, and sure enough, as I was riding down a twisty hill, there was a pack of wild boars around the bend to greet me. Luckily, they scattered, but they looked much scarier in person than in the pictures I had seen.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
I don't have a favorite, but I love riding with my friends in the Auburn, CA area and all of my teammates on Cynisca!
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
My protein pancakes (in various tasty flavors) are essential to my post-ride rituals.

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

The WRX Shoe Covers are perfect for rainy days and keeping dry. I also like the PRO Air Gloves because they are very light and form fitting.

Nik
Nestoroff

GENERAL BIO

My name is Nik Nestoroff, I race mountain bikes professionally for Fezzari Bikes and I‚Äôm based out of San Diego, CA. I specialize in racing Enduro but I love all types of riding and racing. DH, Slalom and even road for training. I grew up racing DH which naturally transitioned into racing Internationally at a young age and competing at the World Cup level ever since. The last few years I have been racing Enduro, and It‚Äôs sparked a whole new love for training and racing for me.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
I love all types of riding so I definitely feel like it depends on the mood I‚Äôm in. One ride/place that comes to mind is Morzine, France. There‚Äôs a handful of bikeparks you can ride all on one lift ticket and they all connect through different valleys and mountains. One of the bike parks in the network is in Champery, Switzerland so I always thought it was super cool you can cross borders on your bike so freely there while enjoying amazing trails, food, and coffee haha.
¬†
What got you into cycling?
My dad got me into riding, he rode most of his life and actually raced DH right around the time I was born. So he was stoked when I showed interest in it at a young age. So not only did we get to spend more time together on the trails but also traveling to races and training are some of the best memories I have with him.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
It‚Äôs hard to single one experience out. I try to group experiences based on specific trips I've been on to cool places with great culture. I‚Äôve seen some amazing wildlife while out on bikes, but one of my favorite experiences bikes have brought me was traveling to Tasmania in March ‚Äò23. The wildlife down there with the geography and everything else involved was super cool and felt like what was a once in a lifetime opportunity.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
I have so many good friends I was lucky enough to meet through riding. The few people I love riding with most are my dad and my girlfriend. I feel so lucky I get to enjoy the trails with not only my dad but also my girlfriend.
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
On race weekends I always try to eat the things that will correctly replenish my body to get me ready for the next day of practice or racing, but at home I love a good burrito after a ride!

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

Lately on these ‚Äúcrisp‚Äù Southern California winter days haha, I‚Äôve been wearing the Summit Trail Pant, with the Canyon Jersey which is such a comfy and casual jersey. I‚Äôve been pairing that with the Summit ECOLoft Vest and I‚Äôve been loving it.

Paige
Onweller

GENERAL BIO

Paige is fairly new to riding bikes (first mass start race was Aug 2021) but accelerated to the front of the peloton quickly in the off-road scene. She focuses on gravel, but also enjoys challenging herself with some endurance mountain biking and road races. She won Big Sugar gravel in 2022, and has been top 10 in the Lifetime Grand Prix the last 2 years. Paige is passionate about getting more women to race and to channel other women to tap into their competitive spirits. She wears a Rosie the Riveter on her jersey to remind herself that women are stronger together, especially in cycling where the gender disparity is still rather large.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
When I first started riding bikes in 2020 to cross train for my running, I did an Everest on a whim. I called it my ‚ÄúCouch to Everest‚Äù plan. I was on a bike I got from a friend for $150 (8 speed, 3x AND rim brakes). It took me nearly 17 hours and I had never descended a mountain before on a bike. It was horrific, but magical at the same time. I was completely untrained and had no idea what I was doing - so what I had to overcome mentally to complete this was really special. It‚Äôs also when I realized that I might have a future in riding bikes if I trained. Oh, and I hallucinated in the last hour‚Ä¶.crazy times.
¬†
What got you into cycling?
I was an injured runner who tried bikes to cross train, then I realized cyclists have more fun and get to eat gummy bears while exercising so I came to the good side and stopped running :)
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
I did a ride through Costa Rica a couple of years ago and experienced numerous microclimates within one ride. It was the most bizarre thing, something that I rarely got to experience prior to that ride. It‚Äôs hard to explain, but it was so cool and wild.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
My sister Megan. She started riding bikes around the same time and although we don‚Äôt ride together often, it‚Äôs really special when we do.
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Homemade sourdough toasted with peanut butter and jam paired with some sort of protein

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

PRO Bib Shorts and the Lobster Gloves!

Samuel
Elson

GENERAL BIO

My name is Samuel Elson, and I grew up in central Minnesota. I currently live in Southern Utah, and I race XC mountain bikes. I love to do long rides out in the middle of nowhere, getting lost on random trails and dirt roads that nobody goes down. One of the biggest wins of my career was the Pro XCO Race at Sea Otter Classic in 2021.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
Riding Captain Ahab with my dad. It's one of our favorite trails of all time. Every ride we do there is one to remember.
¬†
What got you into cycling?
My dad took me mountain biking for the first time when I was about 7 years old, and I was hooked immediately.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
The craziest experience I've had on a mountain bike was racing the UCI World Cup in Snowshoe, West Virginia. Racing a World Cup on home soil was unreal. Fans were amazing, and the whole experience embodied everything I love about the sport.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
Jeremy Norris. Always a goofball, you never know what's going to happen.
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Anything from Chipotle.

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

Easily my PEARL iZUMi Lite Skull Cap. I've had it for well over 10 years, and it's still perfect in a wide range of conditions.

Tess
Edwards

GENERAL BIO

I am Tess Edwards. I am 22 years old and I live in Ojai, CA. I have a bachelors in biology from UCSB and I race for Cynisca Cycling. I love racing bikes, the inclusive community and the high paced intense racing style in the US Crit racing scene really drew me into the sport. In 2023 I won the cat 2/3 overall at Intelligentsia in Chicago. In the 10 days of racing I really came into my own as a rider and got many first place finishes and podiums either off the front solo or in bunch sprints. I am very excited for what the next chapter of racing brings and am beyond grateful to be racing for Cynisca.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
My favorite ride I‚Äôve done was back when I was in middle school. My dad talked me into doing a gravel race with my grandfather. I hated every second of it and was beyond mad at having to wait for my grandfather at the top of every climb. It is a very fond memory for me now that I have gotten older because I know how much it meant for my dad and grandfather to get to share the sport they love with me.
¬†
What got you into cycling?
My father used to race bikes when he was younger and not works in the bike industry. For years he tried to get his kids into cycling but it never really stuck. After I stopped running track in college I started to pick up the bike and quickly fell in love with the sport.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
I coach a group of 6-8 year old girls in mountain biking and every practice I feel like I see something crazy. Wether it‚Äôs how excited they are to try a new skill or how they recount the days ride to their parents telling them how much fun they had on a particularly challenging day.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
I prefer a good solo ride but my Dad sometimes talks his way into riding with me so if I have to choose I‚Äôll say him.
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Waffles.

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

The Women's Attack Long Sleeve is perfect for extra sun protection on long rides. The Women's PRO Mesh Jersey is a must for hot California summers! The Women's Merino Long Sleeve Baselayer is perfect, if like me you get cold the second it drops below 60F.

Whitney
Allison

GENERAL BIO

Whitney Allison has been racing road professionally since 2013. In 2018, mere days before Colorado Classic, she was hit by a driver of an Airstream from behind. The impact of the hit, and the ugly insurance process to ensue, drove her to redefine her career for herself under her own brand, Bike Sports. After her team Hagens Berman Supermint folded in 2019, she planned to transition to gravel in 2020. 2021 saw her on the podium in five of the seven races she entered, and three of them wins. 2022 carried a similar momentum, showcasing her as a consistent, powerful rider. 2023 saw several podiums at races like BWR Arizona, North Carolina, & Kansas. Additional results include events like 1st BWR Utah twice, 4th Unbound twice, and 2nd and 4th and SBTGRVL. For Whitney, the limit pushing and what-ifs fuel her in this space.

Outside of bike racing, Whit utilizes her experience and talents to help people stay on bikes. She co-runs FoCo Fondo, a 9th year gravel cycling event in Fort Collins, Colorado. In addition she co-managed Bike Sports, which in addition to running the racing program, has a bike fit studio, a free route website, and Bike Sports TV. 2021-2023, she also served on the Bicycle Advisory Committee for the City of Fort Collins.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
In 2017, my team Colavita-Bianchi was spending a week riding in Limoux, France before hitting up a few spring classes. We did a training ride through the Gorges De Galamus that was jaw-dropping‚Ä¶and a little scary with the ledges.
¬†
What got you into cycling?
As a high school soccer player burnout, I was looking for a new sport in college and thought triathlon would be fun. I ended up on a ride with the UT Austin collegiate team and although I was immediately dropped, one of the guys stayed back and rode with me. I was hooked and had the perfect introduction to road racing through collegiate cycling. Still have never done a triathlon.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
You know, I think just about any of these gravel races are pretty insane. Just the sheer energy requirements to complete one of these routes is a lot and then to full-gas race it is hard to comprehend, even though I do it multiple times a year. It makes me in awe of the human body.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
Probably Zack. He accuses me of half-wheeling all the time, even though his endurance zone is ‚Äúso much higher‚Äù. We‚Äôve been together for over a dozen years, it‚Äôs fine.
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Loads of seltzer water, a Fat Tire, and anything savory.

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

Women's PRO Bib Shorts, Women's Cyclone Gel Gloves, Women's Expedition Alpha Jacket

Zack
Allison

GENERAL BIO

I'm Zack! I grew up in Arlington, VA and started racing bikes pretty young at 14. I decided pretty promptly to leave Arlington for Fort Collins, Colorado to pursue bike racing and go to Colorado State University. Racing in college and on various elite teams like Mercy Elite Development Cycling and then pro teams. Racing professionally on the road with Elevate Pro Cycling starting in 2014. I scraped together a few wins on Elevate like Team Time Trial and Team Pursuit national titles in 2015. In 2015 I had the grand idea, a bit ahead of it's time, to start FoCo Fondo! Now a staple US gravel event, FoCo Fondo had humble beginnings as a glorified group ride with a couple aid stations. After Elevate I enjoyed the next few years racing for Team Clif Bar where I was on the USA Crits overall podium two years running, raced Unbound gravel for the first time in 2016 coming in 9th place and winning San Rafael Twilight professional criterium in 2018. From 2019 and into the pandemic it was time to mix it up. Going full time gravel with Bike Sports in 2020 when there were basically zero events. Bike Sports, myself and Whitney, focused all of our energy on FoCo Fondo, Bike Sports, eventing and racing. Now, in 2024, Bike Sports, Whitney and Zack are still putting together a full time racing schedule, putting on a 2500 person FoCo Fondo Gravel Race, I'm doing bike fits under the Bike Sports banner, and coaching for Source Endurance.

FUN FACTS

Favorite ride you've ever done and why?
There's a crazy, mostly gravel, 200k loop we do from our front door in Fort Collins. Maybe it's cliche to say your favorite ride is from your front door, but this "200k of Awesomeness" loop has it all.
¬†
What got you into cycling?
My dad and I would ride the huge network of bike paths around DC. I just liked to real fast and race people that didn't know they were being raced.
¬†
Craziest thing they‚Äôve seen/experienced on your bike?
I'll go existential with this one. If you take a step back, and you look at a bike as a means to move around planet earth, it's nuts where you can get to. The bike and the places I've been as a whole are the craziest thing. I've gone bike packing, hundreds of miles from home, carrying everything I need, to places cars can't even get to.
¬†
Favorite riding buddy?
Reluctantly I'll say Whitney. She's great, I'm crazy lucky to have a wife that's enjoyable to ride with, and work with......and live and travel with.....and not really get sick of that much...yet....jk never...
¬†
Favorie post-ride meal?
Chickie nuggies.

FAVORITE PEARL IZUMI PRODUCTS

Men's Pro NeoShell Jacket, Men's Rove Thermal Shirt, Men's AmFIB Gel Gloves¬†

Interested in becoming a PEARL iZUMi Ambassador?

We believe that great rides start with great community, and that includes you! 2024 is the year to break away from the rat race, the never-ending to-do list, and the ‚ÄúI‚Äôll wait until tomorrow‚Äù voice inside your head. This is the year and we want you to be a part of our story.

Join our team! Apply to Become an Ambassador

Apply Now
