Title: Ride 365 - Windy Weather
Body HTML:
RIDE 365¬Æ CLIMATE SYSTEM:

WINDY WEATHER.

Our wind system makes staying comfortable a breeze. From summer gusts to winter‚Äôs chill, our wind gear offers a spectrum of packability and protection so you can keep the pedals turning in every season. ¬†

¬† RIDE 365¬Æ CLIMATE SYSTEM:

WINDY WEATHER.

Our wind system makes staying
comfortable a breeze. From summer gusts to winter‚Äôs chill, our wind gear offers a spectrum of packability and protection
so you can keep the pedals turning in every season. ¬†

YOUR GUIDE TO WINDY WEATHER DRESSING.

Wind chill can alter the temperatures drastically‚Äîespecially as the colder months roll in. For moderately windy days, pack a lightweight gilet or barrier jacket for optional coverage. When the winter chill hits, you‚Äôll need a high-quality windproof layer, such as one with AmFIB¬Æ technology, to keep your core warm. On the coldest of windy days, make sure to protect your hands, head, and toes, and cover up as much of your skin as possible.

SHOP MEN
SHOP WOMEN

YOUR GUIDE TO WINDY WEATHER DRESSING.

Wind chill can alter the temperatures drastically‚Äîespecially as the colder months roll in. For moderately windy days, pack a lightweight gilet or barrier jacket for optional coverage. When the winter chill hits, you‚Äôll need a high-quality windproof layer, such as one with AmFIB¬Æ technology, to keep your core warm. On the coldest of windy days, make sure to protect your hands, head, and toes, and cover up as much of your skin as possible.

SHOP MEN
SHOP WOMEN

WEATHER PROTECTION

CREATE A BARRIER BETWEEN YOU AND THE WIND.

RIDE LIKE YOU

MEAN IT.

Our wind system utilizes lightweight, breathable barrier fabrics that act as a shield between you and the wind. These fabrics are breathable and temperature-regulating. Combined with our durable water repellent (DWR) technology, your wind layer also doubles as protection from light rain.

@layer reset {
  * {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    font: inherit;
  }

  *,
  *::before,
  *::after {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    border-width: 0;
    border-style: solid;
    border-color: var(--global-color-border, currentColor);
  }

  html {
    line-height: 1.5;
    --font-fallback: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto,
      'Helvetica Neue', Arial, 'Noto Sans', sans-serif, 'Apple Color Emoji', 'Segoe UI Emoji', 'Segoe UI Symbol',
      'Noto Color Emoji';
    -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;
    -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
    -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;
    -moz-tab-size: 4;
    tab-size: 4;
    font-family: var(--global-font-body, var(--font-fallback));
  }

  hr {
    height: 0;
    color: inherit;
    border-top-width: 1px;
  }

  body {
    height: 100%;
    line-height: inherit;
  }

  img {
    border-style: none;
  }

  img,
  svg,
  video,
  canvas,
  audio,
  iframe,
  embed,
  object {
    display: block;
    vertical-align: middle;
  }

  img,
  video {
    max-width: 100%;
    height: auto;
  }

  p,
  h1,
  h2,
  h3,
  h4,
  h5,
  h6 {
    overflow-wrap: break-word;
  }

  ol,
  ul {
    list-style: none;
  }

  code,
  kbd,
  pre,
  samp {
    font-size: 1em;
  }

  button,
  [type='button'],
  [type='reset'],
  [type='submit'] {
    -webkit-appearance: button;
    background-color: transparent;
    background-image: none;
  }

  button,
  input,
  optgroup,
  select,
  textarea {
    color: inherit;
  }

  button,
  select {
    text-transform: none;
  }

  table {
    text-indent: 0;
    border-color: inherit;
    border-collapse: collapse;
  }

  input::placeholder,
  textarea::placeholder {
    opacity: 1;
    color: var(--global-color-placeholder, #9ca3af);
  }

  textarea {
    resize: vertical;
  }

  summary {
    display: list-item;
  }

  small {
    font-size: 80%;
  }

  sub,
  sup {
    font-size: 75%;
    line-height: 0;
    position: relative;
    vertical-align: baseline;
  }

  sub {
    bottom: -0.25em;
  }

  sup {
    top: -0.5em;
  }

  dialog {
    padding: 0;
  }

  a {
    color: inherit;
    text-decoration: inherit;
  }

  abbr:where([title]) {
    text-decoration: underline dotted;
  }

  b,
  strong {
    font-weight: bolder;
  }

  code,
  kbd,
  samp,
  pre {
    font-size: 1em;
    --font-mono-fallback: ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Liberation Mono', 'Courier New';
    font-family: var(--global-font-mono, var(--font-mono-fallback));
  }

  input[type="text"],
  input[type="email"],
  input[type="search"],
  input[type="password"] {
    -webkit-appearance: none;
    -moz-appearance: none; 
  }

  input[type='search'] {
    -webkit-appearance: textfield;
    outline-offset: -2px;
  }

  ::-webkit-search-decoration,
  ::-webkit-search-cancel-button {
    -webkit-appearance: none;
  }

  ::-webkit-file-upload-button {
    -webkit-appearance: button;
    font: inherit;
  }

  input[type="number"]::-webkit-inner-spin-button,
  input[type="number"]::-webkit-outer-spin-button {
    height: auto;
  }

  input[type='number']{
    -moz-appearance: textfield;
  }

  :-moz-ui-invalid {
    box-shadow: none;
  }

  :-moz-focusring {
    outline: auto;
  }
}

      /* breakpoints */
@media (min-width: 640px) {
  :host::part(page-container) {
    width: 100%;
    max-width: 36rem;
    padding-left: 0;
    padding-right: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
    margin-right: auto;
  }
}

@media (min-width: 1024px) {
  :host::part(page-container) {
    max-width: 100%;
    padding-left: 52px;
    padding-right: 52px;
    gap: 48px;
  }
}

@media (min-width: 1280px) {
  :host::part(page-container) {
    max-width: 1200px;
    padding-left: 0;
    padding-right: 0;
  }
}

/* top offset for table of contents */
@media (min-width: 1024px) {
    :host .pos_sticky {
        top: 80px;
    }
}

/* custom styles for buy now button */
:host::part(product-purchase-button) {
    height: 3rem;
    width: 175px;
    background: #161718;
    border-radius: 50px;
	text-transform: uppercase;
    line-height: 100%;
    transition-property: opacity;
    transition-duration: 0.3s;
    transition-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1);
}

:host::part(product-purchase-button):hover {
    opacity: .9;
}

/* custom styles for chat activator button */
:host::part(product-chat-activator) {
    height: 3rem;
    width: 225px;
    justify-content: center;
    background: #FFFFFF;
    color: #161718;
    border-color: #161718;
    border-width: 2px;
    border-radius: 50px;
	text-transform: uppercase;
    line-height: 100%;
    transition-property: color, background;
    transition-duration: 0.3s;
    transition-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1);
}

:host::part(product-chat-activator):hover {
    background: #161718;
    color: #FFFFFF;
}
    }</style>

<h1 class="fs_h1 [@container_remarkPageContainer_(max-width:_950px)]:fs_h2 break_break-word font_700 font_fontFamilyHeadings leading_120% text_contentDefault mt_large mb_small" part="title">How to Choose the Best Cycling Socks for Performance and Comfort</h1>
</div>
<hr class="w_100% h_1px border_borderTable">
<div class="d_flex justify_space-between w_100% my_default"><div class="d_flex items_center gap_default">
<div class="d_flex flex_column pos_relative transform_token(sizes.avatarRotation)" part="title-author-avatar-container">

<div class="d_flex flex_column gap_xsmall">
<div class="d_flex items_center gap_small">
<p class="leading_18px font_600 fs_medium font_fontFamily text_contentDefault filter_blur(0px) transition_filter_0.22s will-change_transform loading:filter_blur(token(blurs.loadingText))" part="title-author-name">Quin Friedland  </p>
<div class="d_flex gap_xsmall"><p class="font_fontFamily fs_small text_contentSubtle leading_16px font_400 tracking_-0.1px filter_blur(0px) transition_filter_0.22s will-change_transform">PEARL iZUMi Expert</p></div>
</div>
<p class="fs_small text_contentSubtle font_fontFamily font_400 leading_130% tracking_-0.1px clamp_2" part="title-author-bio">Hey, I‚Äôm Quin! As a Vermont native I‚Äôd say I've spent more time outside than in. In the summers you can find me coaching for a junior MTB team, and in the winter I‚Äôm either ski touring or leading XC ski clinics for all ability levels! Let‚Äôs talk gear!</p>
</div>
</div></div>
</div></div>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">As cyclists, we often focus on the big-ticket items like bikes, shoes, and helmets. But let's not overlook one of the most crucial pieces of gear that can make or break your ride: your socks. The right pair of cycling socks can significantly enhance your performance and comfort on the bike. As someone who's spent countless hours in the saddle, I've learned a thing or two about what makes a great cycling sock. Let's dive into the world of cycling socks and find out how to choose the best ones for your needs!</p>
<h2 id="why-cycling-socks-matter" class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamilyHeadings font_700 fs_h2 [@container_remarkPageContainer_(max-width:_950px)]:fs_h3 leading_120% break_break-word mt_xlarge mb_small" part="heading">Why Cycling Socks Matter</h2>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph"><span>Cycling socks are specially designed to prevent blisters and numb feet, fit snugly without bunching or slipping, and boost overall comfort during your ride.</span> They're not just a fashion statement (although they can certainly add some style to your kit). The right socks can make a significant difference in your cycling experience.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph"><span>PEARL iZUMi's cycling socks are engineered with performance and comfort in mind. They feature moisture-wicking properties that efficiently draw sweat away from your skin, keeping your feet dry and preventing discomfort.</span> This is crucial for long rides or intense training sessions where foot sweat can lead to blisters or hot spots.</p>
<h2 id="key-features-to-look-for-in-cycling-socks" class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamilyHeadings font_700 fs_h2 [@container_remarkPageContainer_(max-width:_950px)]:fs_h3 leading_120% break_break-word mt_xlarge mb_small" part="heading">Key Features to Look for in Cycling Socks</h2>
<h3 id="material-matters" class="text_contentSubtle font_fontFamilyHeadings font_700 fs_h3 [@container_remarkPageContainer_(max-width:_950px)]:fs_h4 leading_120% break_break-word mt_large mb_small" part="subheading">Material Matters</h3>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph"><span>Most high-quality cycling socks are made from synthetic materials like nylon, polyester, or a blend that includes these fibers. These materials excel at moisture management, keeping your feet dry and comfortable even during intense rides.</span></p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">However, don't discount natural fibers. <span>Some cyclists prefer merino wool for its natural moisture-wicking and temperature-regulating properties.</span> Merino wool is especially great for variable weather conditions and can keep your feet comfortable in both warm and cool temperatures.</p>
<h3 id="fit-and-compression" class="text_contentSubtle font_fontFamilyHeadings font_700 fs_h3 [@container_remarkPageContainer_(max-width:_950px)]:fs_h4 leading_120% break_break-word mt_large mb_small" part="subheading">Fit and Compression</h3>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph"><span>Quality cycling socks usually have tech features such as arch compression, sweat-wicking fabric, and an anatomical cut to help keep your feet dry and comfortable throughout the ride.</span> The right fit is crucial - you want socks that hug your feet without being too tight or restrictive.</p>
<h3 id="height" class="text_contentSubtle font_fontFamilyHeadings font_700 fs_h3 [@container_remarkPageContainer_(max-width:_950px)]:fs_h4 leading_120% break_break-word mt_large mb_small" part="subheading">Height</h3>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph"><span>Cycling socks are typically available in three heights: long (reaches to middle of the shin), mid (around standard crew length), and low or ankle (just at or below the ankle).</span> The choice of height is often a matter of personal preference and style, but there are some performance considerations too. Longer socks can provide more protection from the elements and support for your calves, while shorter socks might be cooler in hot weather.</p>
<h3 id="cushioning" class="text_contentSubtle font_fontFamilyHeadings font_700 fs_h3 [@container_remarkPageContainer_(max-width:_950px)]:fs_h4 leading_120% break_break-word mt_large mb_small" part="subheading">Cushioning</h3>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">The amount of cushioning you need depends on your riding style and preferences. Some riders prefer thinner socks for a closer fit in their cycling shoes, while others appreciate extra padding for comfort on longer rides.</p>
<h2 id="top-picks-for-cycling-socks" class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamilyHeadings font_700 fs_h2 [@container_remarkPageContainer_(max-width:_950px)]:fs_h3 leading_120% break_break-word mt_xlarge mb_small" part="heading">Top Picks for Cycling Socks</h2>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">Now that we know what to look for, let's check out some top-notch cycling socks that deliver on performance and comfort.</p>

</div>

<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">If you're hitting the trails, the Merino Trail 7" Sock is a fantastic choice. These socks are designed with mountain biking in mind, featuring extra cushioning in the heel and toe box to provide comfort and protection in MTB footwear.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">The premium Merino wool blend is a game-changer for all-season riding. It wicks moisture effectively, keeping your feet dry even during intense climbs. Plus, the natural antimicrobial properties of Merino wool help keep odors at bay - a blessing for those long days on the bike.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">One of the standout features is the 360-degree tension band around the arch. This provides a secure fit that's ideal for close-fitting cycling shoes, ensuring your socks stay in place no matter how technical the trail gets.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">While these socks are great for most conditions, they might be a bit warm for the hottest summer rides. If you're looking for the absolute lightest option, you might want to consider a different model. But for versatility and comfort across a range of conditions, the Merino Trail 7" Sock is hard to beat.</p>
</div>
<remark-qa-activator></remark-qa-activator>
</div>

<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">For those seeking a versatile sock that can handle a variety of conditions, the Merino Air 7" Sock is an excellent choice. These socks are designed to be your go-to option for year-round cycling comfort.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">The magic of these socks lies in their premium Merino wool blend. This natural fiber excels at temperature regulation, keeping your feet cool in summer and warm in milder winter conditions. The moisture-wicking properties of Merino wool are second to none, ensuring your feet stay dry even during high-intensity rides.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">Like its trail-oriented sibling, the Merino Air features a 360-degree tension band around the arch. This design element provides a secure, no-slip fit that's crucial for efficient power transfer while pedaling. The 7" cuff height offers a good balance of protection and breathability.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">One of the best features of these socks is their natural antimicrobial properties. <span>This means your feet stay not only dry and comfortable but also odor-free, even after long rides.</span> It's a small detail that makes a big difference, especially if you're prone to stopping for a coffee mid-ride!</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">While these socks are great for most conditions, they might not provide enough insulation for extreme cold weather riding. Additionally, if you prefer a heavily cushioned sock, you might find these a bit on the thin side. However, for the vast majority of riding conditions, the Merino Air 7" Sock is a fantastic choice that will keep your feet happy mile after mile.</p>
</div>

</div>

</div>

<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">When it comes to high-performance socks for intense rides and hot weather, the Transfer Air 7" Sock is a standout option. These socks are engineered for cyclists who demand the best in moisture management and breathability.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">The ultra-lightweight Transfer fabric is the star of the show here. <span>Made with an olefin blend, this material is incredibly effective at moving moisture away from your skin, speeding up evaporation and keeping your feet dry.</span> This is crucial for preventing blisters and maintaining comfort during long, sweaty rides.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">Like other PEARL iZUMi socks, the Transfer Air features a 360-degree tension band around the arch. This design element ensures a secure, smooth fit that's ideal for close-fitting cycling shoes. The standard 7" cuff provides good coverage without being overly warm.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">One of the thoughtful details I appreciate is the venting on the top of the foot. This enhances breathability in a key area, helping to prevent overheating even in the hottest conditions. It's these small touches that can make a big difference when you're pushing your limits on the bike.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">Durability is also a key feature of these socks. <span>The reinforced heel and toe areas add longevity to high-wear zones, ensuring these socks will be a part of your kit for many rides to come.</span></p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">While these socks excel in warm weather and high-intensity rides, they might not be the best choice for cold weather cycling. Additionally, if you prefer the feel of natural fibers against your skin, you might want to look at some of the Merino options. But for those hot summer rides or indoor training sessions, the Transfer Air 7" Sock is hard to beat.</p>
</div>
<remark-qa-activator></remark-qa-activator>
</div>

<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">For the cyclist who wants to make a statement with their kit, the Transfer LTD 7" Sock is the perfect choice. These socks combine performance features with bold, eye-catching designs that are sure to turn heads at the coffee shop or on the group ride.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">But don't let the flashy exterior fool you - these socks are serious about performance. <span>They're constructed with a moisture-wicking Transfer fabric made from recycled materials, demonstrating PEARL iZUMi's commitment to sustainability without compromising on function.</span> This fabric keeps your feet dry and comfortable, even during intense efforts.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">The 360-degree tension band around the arch is a feature I've come to expect from PEARL iZUMi socks, and it's present here too. This design element provides a secure fit that's ideal for close-fitting cycling shoes, ensuring your socks stay in place throughout your ride.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">One of the standout features of these socks is the 7" cuff height. This modern, taller sock style not only looks great but also provides additional protection for your lower legs. <span>The venting on the top of the foot enhances breathability, helping to regulate temperature and prevent overheating.</span></p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">While these socks are fantastic for riders who want to add a pop of color to their kit, they might not be the best choice if you prefer more understated, minimalist designs. Additionally, if you're looking for the absolute thinnest sock possible, you might want to consider other options.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">However, for the vast majority of riders looking for a combination of style and substance, the Transfer LTD 7" Sock is an excellent choice. They prove that you don't have to sacrifice performance to look good on the bike.</p>
</div>
<remark-qa-activator></remark-qa-activator>
</div>

</div>
<div class="d_flex gap_8px" part="pros-and-cons-list-item">
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="15" height="15" viewbox="0 0 15 15" fill="none" class="min-w_15px"><g clip-path="url(#clip0_7378_14426)"><path d="M12.8346 6.96407V7.50073C12.8339 8.75865 12.4266 9.98263 11.6734 10.9901C10.9202 11.9976 9.86155 12.7347 8.65526 13.0913C7.44897 13.448 6.1597 13.4052 4.97974 12.9692C3.79978 12.5333 2.79235 11.7276 2.1077 10.6724C1.42304 9.61709 1.09785 8.36877 1.18061 7.11358C1.26338 5.8584 1.74967 4.66359 2.56697 3.70736C3.38426 2.75113 4.48876 2.08471 5.71575 1.80749C6.94273 1.53027 8.22646 1.6571 9.37547 2.16907M12.8346 2.83408L7.0013 8.67324L5.2513 6.92324" stroke="var(--remark-colors-content-success)" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></g><defs><clippath id="clip0_7378_14426"><rect width="14" height="14" fill="var(--remark-colors-bg-default)" transform="translate(0 0.5)"></rect></clippath></defs></svg><p class="text_contentDefault fs_14px font_400 leading_120% font_fontFamily">Durability-focused cyclists</p>

<div class="rounded_default flex_1 p_large border_token(borders.default)_token(colors.borderError)" part="cons-container"><div part="pros-and-cons-list">
<p class="font_fontFamily fs_12px font_600 leading_130% text_contentMuted mb_default">AVOID FOR</p>
<div class="d_flex flex_column gap_small">
<div class="d_flex gap_8px" part="pros-and-cons-list-item">
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="15" height="15" viewbox="0 0 15 15" fill="none" class="min-w_15px"><g clip-path="url(#clip0_7378_14443)"><path d="M5.16797 7.49935H9.83464M13.3346 7.49935C13.3346 10.721 10.723 13.3327 7.5013 13.3327C4.27964 13.3327 1.66797 10.721 1.66797 7.49935C1.66797 4.27769 4.27964 1.66602 7.5013 1.66602C10.723 1.66602 13.3346 4.27769 13.3346 7.49935Z" stroke="var(--remark-colors-content-error)" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></g><defs><clippath id="clip0_7378_14443"><rect width="14" height="14" fill="var(--remark-colors-bg-default)" transform="translate(0.5 0.5)"></rect></clippath></defs></svg><p class="text_contentDefault fs_14px font_400 leading_120% font_fontFamily">Hot summer rides</p>
</div>
<div class="d_flex gap_8px" part="pros-and-cons-list-item">
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="15" height="15" viewbox="0 0 15 15" fill="none" class="min-w_15px"><g clip-path="url(#clip0_7378_14443)"><path d="M5.16797 7.49935H9.83464M13.3346 7.49935C13.3346 10.721 10.723 13.3327 7.5013 13.3327C4.27964 13.3327 1.66797 10.721 1.66797 7.49935C1.66797 4.27769 4.27964 1.66602 7.5013 1.66602C10.723 1.66602 13.3346 4.27769 13.3346 7.49935Z" stroke="var(--remark-colors-content-error)" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></g><defs><clippath id="clip0_7378_14443"><rect width="14" height="14" fill="var(--remark-colors-bg-default)" transform="translate(0.5 0.5)"></rect></clippath></defs></svg><p class="text_contentDefault fs_14px font_400 leading_120% font_fontFamily">Ultra-lightweight needs</p>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div></div>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">When the temperature drops and you're still itching to ride, reach for the Merino Thermal Socks. These socks are designed to keep your feet warm and comfortable in chilly conditions, making them an essential part of any cold-weather cycling kit.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph"><span>What sets these socks apart is their unique blend of Merino wool and recycled polyester. This combination provides the warmth and moisture-wicking properties of Merino with the durability of synthetic fibers.</span> The result is a sock that's not only cozy and comfortable but also built to last.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">One of the standout features of these socks is their thickness. <span>They're twice as thick as PEARL iZUMi's other socks, providing excellent insulation for those frosty morning rides.</span> Despite this extra bulk, they're designed to work well with cycling shoes thanks to a flat seam at the toe.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">I've worn these socks on some seriously cold rides, and I'm always impressed by how warm and dry my feet stay. The extra thickness doesn't compromise pedaling efficiency, but it makes a world of difference when the temperature drops below freezing.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">While these socks excel in cold conditions, they're not the best choice for hot summer rides. If you're looking for an ultra-lightweight sock for racing or high-intensity training in warm weather, you might want to consider other options in the PEARL iZUMi lineup.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">However, for cold weather enthusiasts or cyclists who prioritize durability, the Merino Thermal Socks are a fantastic choice. They prove that you don't have to let cold feet keep you off the bike when the temperature drops.</p>
</div>
<remark-qa-activator></remark-qa-activator>
</div>
<h2 id="caring-for-your-cycling-socks" class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamilyHeadings font_700 fs_h2 [@container_remarkPageContainer_(max-width:_950px)]:fs_h3 leading_120% break_break-word mt_xlarge mb_small" part="heading">Caring for Your Cycling Socks</h2>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">To get the most out of your cycling socks, proper care is essential. Here are a few tips:</p>
<div><ol data-numbered-list="true" class="d_flex flex_column list_inside gap_small mb_default" part="numbered-list">
<li class="pl_default d_flex gap_small" part="numbered-list-item">
<p class="text_primarySubtle font_600 leading_150% fs_default font_fontFamily" part="numbered-list-item-number">1.</p>
<p class="d_inline text_contentDefault font_fontFamily fs_default font_400 leading_150%" part="numbered-list-item-text"><strong>Wash after each use</strong>: This helps prevent the buildup of bacteria and odors.</p>
</li>
<li class="pl_default d_flex gap_small" part="numbered-list-item">
<p class="text_primarySubtle font_600 leading_150% fs_default font_fontFamily" part="numbered-list-item-number">2.</p>
<p class="d_inline text_contentDefault font_fontFamily fs_default font_400 leading_150%" part="numbered-list-item-text"><strong>Turn inside out</strong>: This protects the outer surface and helps clean the areas that come into direct contact with your skin.</p>
</li>
<li class="pl_default d_flex gap_small" part="numbered-list-item">
<p class="text_primarySubtle font_600 leading_150% fs_default font_fontFamily" part="numbered-list-item-number">3.</p>
<p class="d_inline text_contentDefault font_fontFamily fs_default font_400 leading_150%" part="numbered-list-item-text"><strong>Avoid high heat</strong>: Air dry or use a low heat setting to prevent shrinkage and maintain the sock's technical properties.</p>
</li>
<li class="pl_default d_flex gap_small" part="numbered-list-item">
<p class="text_primarySubtle font_600 leading_150% fs_default font_fontFamily" part="numbered-list-item-number">4.</p>
<p class="d_inline text_contentDefault font_fontFamily fs_default font_400 leading_150%" part="numbered-list-item-text"><strong>Skip the fabric softener</strong>: It can clog the fibers and reduce the sock's moisture-wicking abilities.</p>
</li>
</ol></div>
<h2 id="conclusion" class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamilyHeadings font_700 fs_h2 [@container_remarkPageContainer_(max-width:_950px)]:fs_h3 leading_120% break_break-word mt_xlarge mb_small" part="heading">Conclusion</h2>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">Choosing the right cycling socks can significantly enhance your riding experience. Whether you're tackling mountain trails, logging long road miles, or braving the elements in all seasons, there's a perfect sock out there for you. Remember to consider the material, fit, height, and cushioning that best suits your riding style and preferences.</p>
<p class="text_contentDefault font_fontFamily my_default fs_default font_400 leading_150% break_break-word" part="paragraph">Investing in quality cycling socks is a small change that can make a big difference in your comfort and performance on the bike. So next time you're gearing up for a ride, don't forget to give your feet the attention they deserve. Your rides will thank you for it!</p>
</div></div>
</div>
</div></div></template>

Title: Winter Glove Guide
Body HTML:
GUIDE TO

WINTER GLOVES

COOL & COLD WEATHER

GUIDE TO

WINTER GLOVES

COOL & COLD WEATHER

Equipping yourself with gloves for cool and cold weather riding ensures your hands remain warm and responsive, crucial for maintaining control and comfort during your cycling adventures, no matter the temperature.

Equipping yourself with gloves for cool and cold weather riding ensures your hands remain warm and responsive, crucial for maintaining control and comfort during your cycling adventures, no matter the temperature.

¬† COOL WEATHER GLOVES¬†

WHEN SENSITIVITY AND DEXTERITY CAN'T BE SACRIFICES

WHEN SENSITIVITY AND DEXTERITY CAN'T BE SACRIFICED

If you live in milder climates but still enjoy winter riding (or are looking to get into it), we offer a range of cool weather cycling gloves that offer reduced bulk for enhanced bar feel, while still providing light insulation and weather resistance. All of our gloves are touch screen compatible, so no need to brave the cold to update the group on your meetup spot.

Title: Go Grants
Body HTML:
Donating 5% Of Every Purchase

Go Good

Go Good

At PEARL iZUMi, we're dedicated to supporting advocacy programs that lead to more riders and more places to ride.

Go Grants is our way of supporting local cycling initiatives in communities across the country. We believe the best way to grow ridership at the local level is by lifting up communities.

Go Grants focuses on programs that foster new riders, encourage inclusivity, and improve riders‚Äô experiences on trails, through increased access and sustainable maintenance. Read on for the stories of some of the people and organizations behind these ‚ÄúGo-worthy‚Äù efforts - to inspire us all to get involved and keep doing better through bikes.

Apply Now
PROSPECT
SUGAR
FOOTWEAR

BIPOC BIKE
ADVENTURE
GRANT

We worked with athlete and PEARL iZUMi Crew Member Brooke Goudy, who serves as Grant Coordinator for Bikepacking Roots, to support their new Bike Adventure Grant. This new program helps to reduce the barriers to bike adventure for BIPOC individuals. The grants provide funding for recipients who wish to pursue empowering and adventurous experiences by bicycle.

Learn More

BIPOC BIKE
ADVENTURE
GRANT

We worked with athlete and PEARL iZUMi Crew Member Brooke Goudy, who serves as Grant Coordinator for Bikepacking Roots, to support their new Bike Adventure Grant. This new program helps to reduce the barriers to bike adventure for BIPOC individuals. The grants provide funding for recipients who wish to pursue empowering and adventurous experiences by bicycle.

Learn More

BOULDER
MOUNTAIN BIKE
ALLIANCE

The Boulder Mountain Bike Alliance‚Äôs mission is to serve as a positive voice for mountain biking in the greater Boulder Colorado area through group rides and events, advocacy, and trail building. This summer, PEARL iZUMi‚Äôs Brent Smith worked with BMBA to design and donate custom kits for BMBA employees and volunteers.

Learn More

BOULDER
MOUNTAIN BIKE
ALLIANCE

The Boulder Mountain Bike Alliance‚Äôs mission is to serve as a positive voice for mountain biking in the greater Boulder Colorado area through group rides and events, advocacy, and trail building. This summer, PEARL iZUMi‚Äôs Brent Smith worked with BMBA to design and donate custom kits for BMBA employees and volunteers.

Learn More

She Digs

This summer, Kristen Smith, Co-Founder of The Elevated Alpine, and Brooke Goudy, Co-Leader of Black Girls Do Bike Denver teamed up to create a women‚Äôs only trail building retreat in Nederland, Colorado. Go Grant funding served as the catalyst to make this retreat possible, bringing together 50+ industry connected and community minded women to learn about trail maintenance.

Learn More

COMMUNITY
CYCLES

Founded in 2006, Community Cycles is committed to making streets safer for bikes, expanding cycling infrastructure and increasing local ridership by pairing accessibility with sustainability. The Boulder, CO non-profit boasts an education-oriented DIY workshop available to members to wrench on their own bikes, and staffs mechanics who rebuild donated frames into modern, affordable bikes. Community Cycles also directly works as a lobbyist group to create and improve cycling infrastructure across the state. Community Cycles was awarded a Go Grant to help support all of their community-minded initiatives.

Learn More

COMBA WOMEN'S
PROGRAM

This summer, PEARL iZUMi teamed up with the Colorado Mountain Bike Association (COMBA) Women‚Äôs Program, with help from athlete and Crew member Brittany Greer. COMBA creates inclusive rides, clinics, and workshops for female riders throughout the state. Grant money was used to help market and run the program, including dig days and mechanic classes, as well as to provide custom kits for ride leads and sweeps.

Learn More

IRLAG TRIATHLETE
SUPPORT

IRLAG, or I Race Like a Girl, is run by tri-athlete, coach, and PEARL iZUMi Crew member Angela Naeth, and is made up of a community of people who identify as female. IRLAG aims to support female athletes all ages and all abilities in sport, with a specific focus on cycling and triathlon. Grant funds were used to create custom Tri Kits for a team of new Triathletes.

Learn More

SHE DIGS

This summer, Kristen Smith, Co-Founder of The Elevated Alpine, and Brooke Goudy, Co-Leader of Black Girls Do Bike Denver teamed up to create a women‚Äôs only trail building retreat in Nederland, Colorado. Go Grant funding served as the catalyst to make this retreat possible, bringing together 50+ industry connected and community minded women to learn about trail maintenance.

Learn More

CYCLE

The Boulder, CO non-profit boasts an education-oriented DIY workshop available to members to wrench on their own bikes, and staffs mechanics who rebuild donated frames into modern, affordable bikes. Community Cycles also directly works as a lobbyist group to create and improve cycling infrastructure across the state. Community Cycles was awarded a Go Grant to help support all of their community-minded initiatives.

Learn More

COMBA creates inclusive rides, clinics, and workshops for female riders throughout the state. Grant money was used to help market and run the program, including dig days and mechanic classes, as well as to provide custom kits for ride leads and sweeps.

Title: Limited Lifetime Warranty
Body HTML:
UPDATED: 10/12/23

¬†

PEARL iZUMi reserves the right to refuse any items deemed to be in an unsanitary or unsafe condition. Warranty Claims can take up to 30 days to be processed. Please note we cannot make any claims via email.

¬†

[accordion heading="Does my product qualify for the limited lifetime warranty?"content="PEARL iZUMi¬Æ product purchased from PEARL iZUMi¬Æ or an authorized seller is warranted to the original owner against factory defects in materials and workmanship for the lifetime of the product, which is defined as five (5) years. If a product fails due to a manufacturing or materials defect, then PEARL iZUMi¬Æ will replace the product or otherwise make it right.

This limited warranty does not include product failures resulting from accidents, misuse, improper care, chlorinated pools, crash damage, general damage, alterations, modifications or normal wear and tear.

Any alteration of PEARL iZUMi¬Æ brand products will void warranty coverage.

Because PEARL iZUMi cannot control the quality of products sold by unauthorized sellers, this warranty applies only to Products that were purchased from PEARL iZUMi or a PEARL iZUMi authorized seller in the United States, unless otherwise prohibited by law.¬† PEARL iZUMi reserves the right to reject warranty claims for Products purchased from unauthorized sellers, including unauthorized Internet sites or marketplace storefronts."]

[accordion heading="How do I start a warranty claim?"content="Purchasers of Products who wish to make a warranty claim based upon a Product defect should contact PEARL iZUMi at 800-328-8488 or complete the Warranty Claim form in its entirety and shipped alongside the product to the warranty department. (If it is a pair both items need to be sent).

For an item to be considered for warranty replacement, it must be shipped to our warranty for physical review.

PEARL iZUMi does not provide shipping/return labels for Warranty Claims. You are responsible for shipping costs at the carrier of your choice. PEARL iZUMi is not responsible for items lost or damaged in transit.

Replacements are dependent on available inventory."]

[accordion heading="Do I need to pay to ship the item in for inspection?"content="Yes, our warranty department has to physically inspect the item in order to process the claim. ANY ITEMS SUBMITTED FOR WARRANTY THAT ARE NOT CLEAN OR ARE OTHERWISE DEEMED TO BE UNSANITARY WILL BE RETURNED."]

¬†

[accordion heading="Do¬†you process warranty claims from outside of the United States?"content="We cannot accept warranty claims¬†from outside of the United States.

REPLACEMENTS AS PROVIDED UNDER THIS WARRANTY ARE THE EXCLUSIVE REMEDY OF THE CONSUMER. PEARL iZUMi SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES FOR BREACH OF ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTY ON THIS PRODUCT. Some States do not allow the exclusion or limitation of incidental or consequential damages, so the above limitation or exclusion may not apply to you.¬† Any implied warranties that may be applicable to Products, including implied warranties of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose, are limited in duration to the duration of this warranty.¬† Some States do not allow limitations on how long an implied warranty lasts, so the above limitation may not apply to you.

This warranty gives you specific legal rights, and you may also have other rights which vary from State to State."]

Title: Welcome to PEARL iZUMi
Body HTML:
Welcome to PEARL iZUMi

Activate Discount

Q: What is the PEARL iZUMi Pro Program?

A: The PEARL iZUMi Pro Program offers generous merchandise discounts to select qualified cycling and outdoor professionals. In exchange for an exclusive discount and early access to new releases, we value Pros who help further our advocacy mission, share their cycling experience with family and friends, tag @pearlizumiofficial and #ridemoredomore on Instagram, and leave product reviews.

Q: Who is eligible?

A: Pro Program membership is approved on a case-by-case basis. We invite professional cyclists, individuals who are employed full-time directly in the cycling or related outdoor industry, first responders and military personnel to apply. Current valid proof of employment is required.

Q: How to apply?

A: Please follow the steps below.

1. Please start by creating a standard (non-Pro) account HERE. Follow the instructions to activate your account. If you already have a PEARL iZUMi account, skip ahead to the next step.

2. Fill out your Pro application HERE. Please make sure to provide your proof of current employment, relevant certifications, athletic resume, or any other documentation PEARL iZUMi should consider for approval.

3. Thanks for your application! It will take 3-5 business days to be reviewed. You will be emailed as soon as we process your application.

Pro Program Rules

If accepted, remember that this discount is for you and you alone, and this will be strictly enforced. We ask that you also respect the following rules around the PEARL iZUMi Pro Program:

  • Do not purchase products for friends, family, or anyone else in your household. This is strictly monitored and if we find any abuse, your account and discount will be terminated.
  • Never visit a PEARL iZUMi retail partner to try product on or to conduct returns or exchanges. Instead, we welcome you to use your Pro Program discount online, or directly at our PEARL iZUMi Factory Stores. Find a store HERE.
  • Warranty & Returns: We want you to be completely satisfied with your purchase, but if something isn‚Äôt right, let us know and we will work with you to make it right. Learn more HERE.
  • Sales may not be combined with any other offers or discounts. Discounts cannot be applied retroactively.
  • PEARL iZUMi grants non-transferable benefits. You must keep your account information confidential! PEARL iZUMi assumes no liability for fraudulent use of your account by third parties.

If you have any questions, please email us: pearlizumipro@pearlizumi.com.

Title: Indoor Fitness Guide
Body HTML:
Made For
Life In Motion

Made For
Life in Motion

Ideal for riders looking for versatility.

Modern silhouettes, featuring yoga inspired waistbands and cropped tanks, offer a wear-anywhere aesthetic. Technical features, like a minimal, removable chamois, provide flexibility and comfort, while reflective elements offer visibility and safety. From commuting around town to after work yoga, or hitting the trails, each piece is made for a life in motion.

PROSPECT
SUGAR
FOOTWEAR

Prospect

Athleisure aesthetics get the performance treatment in the Prospect Collection. Feature-rich pieces made for life by bike and beyond blend into your everyday life, thanks to outdoor inspired patterns and color combinations. Prospect keeps crossover appeal high on the list while catering specifically to the demands of the bike.

(Solely for purposes of this Arbitration Provision, the term Transaction Parties also includes any third party providing any goods and/or services in connection with the use of the Site and the Services or any of the foregoing on behalf of a Transaction Party, if that third party is named as a defendant along with a Transaction Party in the same proceeding or a related proceeding.)


‚ÄúDispute‚Äù Defined. Except as otherwise explicitly provided in this Arbitration Provision, ‚ÄúDispute‚Äù broadly includes, without limitation: any claims based in contract, statute, constitution, ordinance, tort, fraud, consumer rights, misrepresentation, equity, or any other legal theory; initial claims, counterclaims, cross-claims, and third-party claims; federal, state, and local claims; and claims which arose before the date of your use of the Services, including, but not limited to, any dispute or claim arising before the date you accessed the Site or the Services or agreed to these Terms of Use and any dispute or claim relating to (by way of example and not limitation): (i) the use, denial, or termination of the Services and/or the events leading up thereto; (ii) any disclosure, advertisement, application, solicitation, promotion, or oral or written statement, warranty, or representation made by or on behalf of a Transaction Party; (iii) any product or service provided by or through a Transaction Party or third parties in connection with the use of the Services or the relationship between you and a Transaction Party and any associated fees; (iv) a Transaction Party‚Äôs use or failure to protect any personal information you give a Transaction Party in connection with the use of the Services or your relationship with the Transaction Party; (v) enforcement of any and all of the obligations a party may have to another party in connection with the use of the Services or agreement governing the same; or (viii) compliance with applicable laws and/or regulations.


Exceptions to ‚ÄúDispute.‚Äù Notwithstanding any of the foregoing: (i) disputes or controversies about the validity, enforceability, coverage, or scope of this Arbitration Provision or any part thereof are for a court and not an arbitrator to decide; however, disputes or controversies about these Terms of Use or your agreements governing the use of the Services or with Transaction Parties as a whole are for an arbitrator and not a court to decide; (ii) any Disputes seeking to enforce or protect, or concerning the validity of intellectual property rights, will not be subject to binding arbitration under this Arbitration Provision; and (iii) any party may proceed with their individual claims in small claims court (or an equivalent court) if that option is available in the applicable jurisdiction and the amount in controversy falls within the small claims court‚Äôs (or the equivalent court‚Äôs) jurisdictional limits; but if that action is transferred, removed, or appealed to a different court, arbitration can be elected. Moreover, this Arbitration Provision will not apply to any Dispute that was already pending in court before this Arbitration Provision took effect.


Governing Law. The Federal Arbitration Act (‚ÄúFAA‚Äù), 9 U.S.C. 1 et seq., and federal arbitration law apply to this Arbitration Provision. There is no judge or jury in arbitration and court review of an arbitration award is limited, but an arbitrator can award an individual the same damages and relief as a court in an individual case and must apply and follow applicable substantive law, consistent with the FAA, and the terms of these Terms of Use and any agreement governing the use of the Site and the Services. The parties further agree that, in order to bring a claim in arbitration, they must first be able to satisfy the federal standing requirement under Article III of the United States Constitution with respect to their claims, and that the arbitrator shall be empowered to make a binding determination on standing. The arbitrator shall apply applicable statutes of limitations and honor privilege rules. Any judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator will be final, subject to any appeal rights under the FAA, and may be entered in any court of competent jurisdiction. No arbitration award involving the parties will have any preclusive effect as to issues or claims in any dispute involving anyone who is not a party to the arbitration, nor will an arbitration award in prior disputes involving other parties have preclusive effect in an arbitration between the parties to this Arbitration Provision.


JURY TRIAL WAIVER. YOU UNDERSTAND THAT ABSENT YOUR CONSENT TO ARBITRATION, YOU WOULD HAVE THE RIGHT TO SUE IN COURT AND HAVE A TRIAL BY JURY.


Arbitration Procedures. Either you or a Transaction Party can initiate arbitration through the AAA or by filing a motion to compel arbitration of claims filed in court. Regardless of who elected arbitration or how arbitration was elected, the party asserting the claim (i.e., the party seeking money damages or other relief from a court or an arbitrator) is responsible for starting the arbitration proceeding. If the AAA cannot serve and we cannot agree on a substitute, a court with jurisdiction shall select the arbitrator, who will apply the AAA rules and the procedures specified in this Arbitration Provision. Any arbitrator must be a practicing attorney with ten or more years of experience practicing law or a retired judge. Any arbitration will be governed by the then-current Consumer Rules, and its Procedures for the Resolution of Disputes through Document Submission (‚ÄúDocument Submission Procedures‚Äù). For more information about the AAA and its rules, you may contact the AAA at American Arbitration Association, 120 Broadway, Floor 21, New York, N.Y. 10271, 1-800-778-7879, www.adr.org. The Document Submission Procedures are included in the Consumer Rules. The parties shall pay filing, administrative and arbitrator fees in accordance with the Consumer Rules. If you cannot afford to pay your share of the fees and cannot obtain a waiver from the AAA, you can make a written good faith request for a Transaction Party to pay or advance such fees. Each party will bear the expense of its own attorneys, experts and witnesses, regardless of which party prevails, unless applicable law, these Terms of Use or an applicable agreement gives a party the right to recover such expenses from the other party. If the arbitrator determines that any party‚Äôs claim or defense is frivolous or wrongfully intended to oppress or harass the other party, or lacks standing as required by these Terms, the arbitrator may award sanctions in the form of fees and expenses reasonably incurred by the other party if such sanctions could be imposed under Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure. The parties agree that either party may submit dispositive motions in advance of any final arbitration hearing on the merits. The arbitration will be conducted by a single arbitrator solely based on written submissions and will not require any personal appearance by the parties or witnesses unless the arbitrator determines that a telephonic or in-person conference or hearing is necessary based on the request of one or more of the parties. If an in-person hearing is necessary, it will be held in the federal judicial district in which you reside or at another location that is reasonably convenient to all parties.


CLASS ACTION WAIVER. You and the Transaction Parties each agree that if arbitration of a Dispute is elected, the Dispute will be resolved in arbitration (not in court) only on an individual basis and not as a class, collective or other representative action. To the fullest extent permitted under the FAA: (a) no arbitration will be joined or consolidated with any other unless all parties otherwise agree in writing; (b) there is no right or authority for any Dispute to be arbitrated on a class-action, collective action or private attorney general basis or to utilize class action procedures; and (c) there is no right or authority for any Dispute to be brought in a purported representative capacity on behalf of the general public or any other persons. No arbitrator shall have the authority to issue any relief that applies to any person or entity other than Transaction Parties and/or you individually.


Miscellaneous; Conflicts. Even if all parties have opted to litigate a Dispute in court, a party may elect arbitration with respect to any claim made by a new party or any claim later asserted by a party in that or any related or unrelated lawsuit (including a claim initially asserted on an individual basis but modified to be asserted on a class, representative, or multi-party basis). Nothing in that litigation shall constitute a waiver of any rights under this Arbitration Provision. If any portion of this Arbitration Provision is inconsistent with the Consumer Rules, with these Terms of Use, or your agreements governing the use of the Services, or with an arbitration provision in any agreement with a Transaction Party, this Arbitration Provision shall govern.


Survival; Severance. This Arbitration Provision shall survive termination of the Site and the Services or these Terms of Use or of any agreement into which you enter with a Transaction Party; and, further, you understand and agree that this Arbitration Provision applies not only to these Terms of Use but also to any subsequent agreement (including without limitation any agreement governing the use of Site or Services) into which you enter with a Transaction Party. If any portion of this Arbitration Provision is deemed invalid or unenforceable, it shall not invalidate the remaining portions of this Arbitration Provision, except that: (a) if the Class Action Waiver is limited, voided or found unenforceable with respect to a Dispute that does not seek public injunctive relief and that determination becomes final after all appeals have been exhausted, then this Arbitration Provision (except for this sentence) shall be null and void with respect to such proceeding. The parties acknowledge and agree that under no circumstances will a class action be arbitrated; and (b) if a claim is brought seeking public injunctive relief and a court determines that the restrictions in the Class Action Waiver or elsewhere in this Arbitration Provision prohibiting the arbitrator from awarding relief on behalf of third parties are unenforceable with respect to such claim and that determination becomes final after all appeals have been exhausted, the claim for public injunctive relief will be determined in court and any individual claims seeking monetary relief will be arbitrated. In such a case the parties will request that the court stay the claim for public injunctive relief until the arbitration award pertaining to individual relief has been entered in court. In no event will a claim for public injunctive relief be arbitrated.


RIGHT TO OPT OUT: If you do not want this Arbitration Provision to apply, you must send us a signed notice within thirty (30) calendar days of the date on which you electronically submit an application for a product or service offered by a Transaction Party through the Site or Services. You must send the notice in writing (and not electronically) to 11488 Slater Avenue, Fountain Valley, CA 92708. You must provide your name, address, telephone number, and state that you ‚Äúopt out‚Äù of the Arbitration Provision. Opting out will not affect the other provisions of these Terms of Use or any other agreement governing the Site or with a Transaction Party. If you do not opt out, you will be bound by this Arbitration Provision in these Terms of Use and any other agreement governing a Service or with a Transaction Party. Please note that if you enter an agreement with a Transaction Party that contains a different arbitration provision with a right to opt out, opting out of this Arbitration Provision is not a rejection of the arbitration provision in the other agreement. You will need to separately opt out of the arbitration provision in the other agreement if you do not want it to apply.


21. CHANGES

You are responsible for reviewing these Terms regularly. United Sports Brands reserves the right, at any time, without notice to you, and in its sole discretion, to modify or discontinue the Services, these Terms, or any of our policies related to use of the Services. We will not amend the Arbitration Provision or Class Action Waiver, described below, in a manner that adversely affects your rights or responsibilities in a material manner unless we give you a right to reject the amendment and/or the Arbitration Provision and Class Action Waiver in its entirety. Revisions to these Terms or our policies may be provided through the Services, including by posting the revisions on the Services and updating the ‚ÄúLast Updated‚Äù date. Such revisions will go into immediate effect once posted to the Services. Continued use of the Services following such modifications to the Services, these Terms, additional terms and conditions for any service, or our other policies will constitute your acceptance of such modifications and revisions.


22. MISCELLANEOUS

These Terms constitute the entire agreement of the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersede all previous written or oral agreements between the parties with respect to such subject matter. No waiver by either party of any breach or default hereunder shall be deemed to be a waiver of any preceding or subsequent breach or default. The section headings used in these Terms shall not be given any legal import.


These Terms of Use shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York (without regard to provisions relating to conflicts of law), except as to copyright and trademark matters, which are covered by American federal laws. You agree that any legal action or proceeding between United Sports Brands and you for any purpose concerning these Terms or the parties‚Äô obligations hereunder shall be resolved individually, without resort to any form of class action, exclusively in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, or, if there is not subject matter jurisdiction, in the courts of the State of New York, and you agree to submit to the jurisdiction of these courts. You waive any venue, personal jurisdiction, and inconvenient forum objections or defenses to such courts.


These Terms of Use are not assignable, transferable, or sublicensable by you except with United Sports Brands‚Äô prior written consent.


United Sports Brands may assign its rights and duties under these Terms of Use at any time without notice to you.


No waiver by either party of any breach or default hereunder shall be deemed to be a waiver of any preceding or subsequent breach or default.


23. CONTACT INFORMATION

If you need to contact us regarding the Sites, the Services or these Terms of Use, please reach out to us info@pearlizumi.com.

Title: Returns & Exchanges
Body HTML:
Returns

To¬†start a PEARL iZUMi return or exchange, please click here. ¬†Please have your email order confirmation number and shipping zip code ready.¬†

Returns: Due to COVID-19 concerns, PEARL iZUMi reserves the right to refuse any items deemed to be in an unsanitary or unsafe condition. Additionally, due to increased volume and the impact of COVID-19, we are experiencing delays in return processing.

  • Final Sale Items are not¬†eligible for return.¬†
  • New and unused merchandise may be returned with the original tags attached, up to 30 days from the date of purchase for a refund.Please return item(s) in the original packaging.
  • Returns will be refunded to the original card used to purchase the item(s).¬†
  • The online return process will require a printer, as you are provided a PDF to download that includes a shipping label and return document. If you do not have a printer, a local office supply store or library may be able to assist in printing.
  • Return authorization is not necessary, and we do not issue RA#s for consumer returns.

SPECIAL HOLIDAY WINDOW RETURNS & EXCHANGES

We understand holiday shopping can be tricky.¬†To make life a little easier we have extended our return/exchange window for orders fulfilled 10/04/22 - 12/26/22. Orders¬†fulfilled during this time frame have until 01/31/23 to return or exchange. Rest easy and¬†grab those holiday gifts¬†early!

¬†

Returns and exchanges are only accepted for products purchased directly through www.pearlizumi.com.If you purchased from a retail partner or another source, then they must arrange your return or exchange.

New and unused merchandise may be returned with the original tags attached up to 30 days from the date of purchase for a refund. A credit will be issued to the original credit card for the item(s) amount, less shipping and handling.¬†
[accordion heading="The return form says I need to include my packing slip, but I can't find it." content="Our packing slips are either in a plastic envelope on the outside of the box, or under the shipping label. If yours was under the shipping label and you cut it in half, please submit the part with your order number and item. If you have thrown away your packing list please print a copy of your order confirmation email and include that with your return."][accordion heading="I cut¬† the hang tags off the garment, can I still return it?" content="If you have only removed the hang tags, then yes, you can still return the new and unused item. However, you will need to include the hangtags with your return so we can reattach them at the warehouse. Unfortunately, if you have also removed the sewn in white product care tags, we will be unable to accept the return."][accordion heading="I need to return something, but my credit card number has changed since I made my¬† order, can I still get my refund?" content="If you received a new credit card number from the same issuing bank, it will not be a problem to refund your credit card. Just like all pending payment transactions carry forward onto your new card, so will your refunds.

However, if you closed the account with that issuing bank and opened a new credit card with a different bank, please contact us at info@pearlizumi.com before sending back your return."][accordion heading="I received my return email confirmation, but I don't see my¬† refund on my statement. Are you sure it went through?" content="Most banks take 3-6 business days for the refunded amount to reflect in your available balance. While 3-6 business days is standard, some banks can take much longer. If you use multiple cards for your online transactions, please be sure you are checking the correct account. If you used PayPal to checkout, your refund will go back to your PayPal account. You then have the option to use that amount for any future payment via PayPal or you may transfer it to your bank account."]

Exchanges

Due to COVID-19 concerns, PEARL iZUMi reserves the right to refuse any items deemed to be in an unsanitary or unsafe condition.

Additionally, due to increased volume and the impact of COVID-19, we are experiencing delays in exchange processing.
  • Final sale items are not eligible for an exchange.
  • If the exchanged item is no longer available the original card used to purchase will be automatically refunded for the order (excludes shipping).
  • RETURNING AN EXCHANGED ITEM: While our automated system only allows for an item to be returned or exchanged one time, we are happy to help set up a return for this item. Please email info@pearlizumi.com with "EXCHANGE RETURN" and our customer support team will be happy to assist.
  • New and unused merchandise may be exchanged for the same item, in a new color or size, with the original tags attached.
  • New items will ship once returned items have been received and processed.
  • Due to COVID-19, we will return any product that appears to be worn. We reserve the right to refuse any items deemed to be in an unsanitary or unsafe condition.
  • Exchanges will be accepted up to 30 days from the date of purchase.
  • Please return item(s) in the original packaging.
  • The online exchange process will require a printer, as you are provided a PDF to download that includes a shipping label and return document. If you do not have access to a printer, please visit your local UPS store.
Please allow up to 30 business days for your exchange to be processed. Defective and incorrect items If you receive defective or incorrect items, please contact us at info@pearlizumi.com or 1-800-328-8488, prior to sending these items back.

Title: PEARL iZUMi's Ultimate Guide to Cycling Gloves for the Fall/Winter
Body HTML:
üîç

Product Review

PEARL iZUMi's Ultimate Guide to Cycling Gloves for the Fall/Winter

written by

Marion R.

Embrace the Elements with Comfort

When the seasons shift, cyclists face the challenge of maintaining comfort and performance in the saddle. PEARL iZUMi's AmFIB¬Æ Lite Gloves emerge as the quintessential accessory for riders braving the chill of fall and the crisp beginnings of spring. Fusing PrimaLoft Gold insulation with a tactful, non-insulated palm, these gloves are the rider's answer to unpredictable weather.

‚úì

60g PrimaLoft Gold

‚úì

Ax Suede Laredo palm

‚úì

Windproof fabric

‚úì

Durable synthetic leather

Balance of Warmth and Control

Navigating the delicate balance between staying warm and keeping a steady hand on the handlebars, the 60g PrimaLoft Gold insulation offers unmatched warmth with minimal bulk. The AmFIB¬Æ Lite Gloves ensure that your hands remain an extension of your intent, guiding your ride seamlessly with the Ax Suede Laredo palm. With the absence of insulation here, control is uncompromised, allowing for the kind of dexterity that can make all the difference during a cool morning cross-country workout or a breezy spring climb. The windproof fabric contributes to a greater riding experience, protecting against the bite of the morning air, while the gloves' durability is evident in the synthetic leather palm, tailored to be as grippy as it is robust.

A great addition for those chill Fall days. These gloves are comfy and affective!

written by

Marion R.

The Ideal Cold-Weather Companion

In the ebb and flow of seasonal changes, the PEARL iZUMi AmFIB¬Æ Lite Gloves stand firm as the ideal partner for dedicated cyclists. By combining essential qualities like warmth, grip, and dexterity, these gloves are not just an accessory but an enhancement to your riding experience across different weather conditions.

$55.00

AmFIB¬Æ Lite Gloves

Title: PEARL iZUMi Digital Accessibility Statement
Body HTML:
Our Policy & Commitment

At PEARL iZUMi, we are committed to accessibility, diversity, and inclusion. As part of that commitment, we are making efforts to ensure that PEARL iZUMi‚Äôs digital properties are accessible to all individuals, regardless of ability. In doing so,¬†PEARL iZUMi has a goal to comply with applicable accessibility standards included in the W3C‚Äôs WCAG 2.2 AA guidelines.

Digital Accessibility Statement

We are working to ensure our websites and online services are accessible for all and are committed to following the W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines and other applicable web accessibility laws.

To accomplish this, we have partnered with Level Access to leverage their digital accessibility platform and 25 years of experience to achieve and sustain conformance to accessibility standards. Their digital accessibility platform is used to evaluate our digital properties in accordance with best practices and is supported by a diverse team of accessibility professionals, including users with disabilities.

Through this partnership,¬†PEARL iZUMi continues to develop our digital accessibility program and capabilities so that we are designing, developing, and testing our websites and online services for conformance to accessibility standards.

Contact

We want to hear from you. If you would like further information about PEARL iZUMi‚Äôs accessibility efforts, have other accessibility questions or feedback, or encounter accessibility barriers on our digital properties, please contact: info@pearlizumi.com

Last updated: 09.04.2024

Title: How to Choose the Right Cycling Base Layer
Body HTML:
<template shadowrootmode="open"><style type="text/css">@layer reset, base, tokens, recipes, utilities;

@layer reset{
  html,:host {
    --font-fallback: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', Arial, 'Noto Sans', sans-serif, 'Apple Color Emoji', 'Segoe UI Emoji', 'Segoe UI Symbol', 'Noto Color Emoji';
    line-height: 1.5;
    -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;
    -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
    -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;
    -moz-tab-size: 4;
    tab-size: 4;
    font-family: var(--global-font-body, var(--font-fallback));
    -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
}

  *,::before,::after,::backdrop,::file-selector-button {
    margin: 0px;
    padding: 0px;
    border-width: 0px;
    border-style: solid;
    border-color: var(--global-color-border, currentcolor);
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

  hr {
    color: inherit;
    height: 0px;
    border-top-width: 1px;
}

  body {
    line-height: inherit;
    height: 100%;
}

  img {
    border-style: none;
}

  img,svg,video,canvas,audio,iframe,embed,object {
    display: block;
    vertical-align: middle;
}

  img,video {
    max-width: 100%;
    height: auto;
}

  h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,h6 {
    text-wrap: balance;
    font-size: inherit;
    font-weight: inherit;
}

  p,h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,h6 {
    overflow-wrap: break-word;
}

  ol,ul,menu {
    list-style: none;
}

  button,input:where([type='button'], [type='reset'], [type='submit']),::file-selector-button {
    appearance: button;
    -webkit-appearance: button;
}

  button,input,optgroup,select,textarea,::file-selector-button {
    font: inherit;
    background: transparent;
    font-feature-settings: inherit;
    font-variation-settings: inherit;
    letter-spacing: inherit;
    color: inherit;
}

  ::placeholder {
    --placeholder-fallback: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);
    opacity: 1;
    color: var(--global-color-placeholder, var(--placeholder-fallback));
}

  @supports (not (-webkit-appearance: -apple-pay-button)) or (contain-intrinsic-size: 1px) {
    ::placeholder {
      --placeholder-fallback: color-mix(in oklab, currentcolor 50%, transparent);
}
}

  ::selection {
    background-color: var(--global-color-selection, rgba(0, 115, 255, 0.3));
}

  textarea {
    resize: vertical;
}

  table {
    border-color: inherit;
    text-indent: 0px;
    border-collapse: collapse;
}

  summary {
    display: list-item;
}

  small {
    font-size: 80%;
}

  sub,sup {
    font-size: 75%;
    line-height: 0;
    position: relative;
    vertical-align: baseline;
}

  sub {
    bottom: -0.25em;
}

  sup {
    top: -0.5em;
}

  dialog {
    padding: 0px;
}

  a {
    text-decoration: inherit;
    color: inherit;
}

  abbr:where([title]) {
    text-decoration: underline dotted;
}

  b,strong {
    font-weight: bolder;
}

  code,kbd,samp,pre {
    --font-mono-fallback: ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Liberation Mono', 'Courier New';
    font-family: var(--global-font-mono, var(--font-mono-fallback));
    font-size: 1em;
    font-feature-settings: normal;
    font-variation-settings: normal;
}

  progress {
    vertical-align: baseline;
}

  ::-webkit-search-decoration,::-webkit-search-cancel-button {
    -webkit-appearance: none;
}

  ::-webkit-inner-spin-button,::-webkit-outer-spin-button {
    height: auto;
}

  :-moz-ui-invalid {
    box-shadow: none;
}

  :-moz-focusring {
    outline: auto;
}

  [hidden]:where(:not([hidden='until-found'])) {
    display: none !important;
}
}

      /* breakpoints */
@media (min-width: 640px) {
  :host::part(page-container) {
    width: 100%;
    max-width: 36rem;
    padding-left: 0;
    padding-right: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
    margin-right: auto;
  }
}

@media (min-width: 1024px) {
  :host::part(page-container) {
    max-width: 100%;
    padding-left: 52px;
    padding-right: 52px;
    gap: 48px;
  }
}

@media (min-width: 1280px) {
  :host::part(page-container) {
    max-width: 1200px;
    padding-left: 0;
    padding-right: 0;
  }
}

/* top offset for table of contents */
@media (min-width: 1024px) {
    :host .pos_sticky {
        top: 80px;
    }
}

/* custom styles for buy now button */
:host::part(product-purchase-button) {
    height: 3rem;
    width: 175px;
    background: #161718;
    border-radius: 50px;
	text-transform: uppercase;
    line-height: 100%;
    transition-property: opacity;
    transition-duration: 0.3s;
    transition-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1);
}

:host::part(product-purchase-button):hover {
    opacity: .9;
}

/* custom styles for chat activator button */
:host::part(product-chat-activator) {
    height: 3rem;
    width: 225px;
    justify-content: center;
    background: #FFFFFF;
    color: #161718;
    border-color: #161718;
    border-width: 2px;
    border-radius: 50px;
	text-transform: uppercase;
    line-height: 100%;
    transition-property: color, background;
    transition-duration: 0.3s;
    transition-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1);
}

:host::part(product-chat-activator):hover {
    background: #161718;
    color: #FFFFFF;
}
    }</style>

<p class="lh_18px fw_600 fs_medium ff_fontFamily c_contentDefault filter_blur(0px) trs_filter_0.22s will-change_transform loading:filter_blur(token(blurs.loadingText))" part="title-author-name">Quin Friedland  </p>
<div class="d_flex gap_xsmall"><p class="ff_fontFamily fs_small c_contentSubtle lh_16px fw_400 ls_-0.1px filter_blur(0px) trs_filter_0.22s will-change_transform">PEARL iZUMi Expert</p></div>
